    2013-12-10: Got this for my grandma and her new phone, and it works really well. I've had this on my older phones as well, and it sure is durable. I've tried scratching it with keys, and coins with no problem at all. Held up really well and durable. It does run on the sticky side, so if you plan on using certain styli with it, it might not run as smooth.

    Rating: 5

    2013-05-09: At first I thought this product just included the front screen protector(SP) so I was surprised to find teh full-body protection. I don't understand why people complain about the installation. Just watch a couple Youtube videos on how to install and you're good. I've installed these on four devices now with no issue's. A iPhone 4s is my primary. This one I did have to remove it once I had pressed the solution out but it was my mistake. Zagg allows 3-5 minutes for removal and re-install but I don't recommend it. Sometimes the removal stretches the screen protector. My mistake during install was not holding down the opposite side which i'm pressing so the SP doesnt move. Also, I found using a lot of the solution allows for easy install. Don't be stingy with the solution cause in the end, it's only one SP per package(unless noted) so use a lot. Just keep a terry cloth handy to wipe the excess water from the sides(not on the screen prior to install as it will leave particles) and press to the sides.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-24: It's mediocre. It turns yellow after a while and MIGHT leave some sticky residue on your phone. It's great for protection though.

    Rating: 3

    2012-07-15: The US version of the phone differs as it has a Qualcomm Snapdragon S4 Processor with 1.5 GHz Dual-Core CPUs, while the the rest of the hardware specs are the same as the international version.I switched from an HTC EVO 4G to get this phone and so far it's been great! Here are the things I like about the phone:* The phone is a nice size, it's lighter than my HTC EVO 4G.* The processor is one of the fastest US released Android phone, and it comes with 2 GB of RAM.* I played around with the camera and video camera and the quality is great in my opinion. (I'll post some pics or a video later.)* The ICS 4.0 is really snappy and it opens up applications quickly.* It comes with Google Wallet. I signed up and got a free $10 to use. (I'm going to McDonald's to test it out!)* I've only use the S Voice application a few times, but it seems to be just like Siri on my wife's iPhone 4S.* It comes with a micro SD slot in case more space is needed to save pictures, videos, etc.* You can change out the battery if needed.* Battery life last twice as long compared to my HTC EVO 4G.Now for some cons:* This is carrier related and not the phone itself, but the 4G LTE is not all in all areas so be sure to check your carrier if internet speeds is a deciding factor in purchasing this phone. If not you'll be stuck with 3G speeds.* The phone is so nice, that I baby it all the time!I was on the fence about getting this phone or the HTC EVO 4G LTE aka HTC One X. The main things that I like over the the Samsung Galaxy 3 over the HTC EVO 4G LTE is that it comes with the Micro SD slot and also the battery can be changed if it ever goes bad.I love this phone! :)

    Rating: 5

    2013-05-23: It is a great phone and the Amazon price and delivery were fantastic. We bought two of these phones. Came with Jelly Bean already installed. When charging for first time noticed that the charging LED was not the same color. Should be red but was almost yellow. The phone also had very short battery life after full charge. Other phone lasted more than a day. I would not have realized the problem if we had not bought two. Called Amazon and they arranged for a replacemet immediately. Service and follow-up by Amazon was great. New phone works exactly like the other phone now. The replacement phone was not a reconditioned phone like you get from At&T or Verizon.

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-02: Excellent phone! This is my first touch screen phone. I'm still trying to learn all of it's functions. Meets all of my expectations. I give it 5 stars.

    Rating: 5

    2012-10-09: To preface this review, I've had the following smartphones most recently in this order:iphone 3gsiphone 4HTC inspireSamsung Galaxy s2 skyrocketSamsung Galaxy s3PROS:- screen size and resolution. 4.8"beast 720x1280.- Screen clarity is amazing. I can clearly read the screen in broad daylight with no strain.- Processor is blazing fast. No lag with multiple apps open and switching between them.- size, shape, and weight are all perfect for me. This phone is surprisingly thin.- speaker phone is loud and clear- cell phone reception and internet speed are exceptional- call clarity is excellent- GPS works MUCH better than the HTC inspire, and as good or better than the skyrocket- battery life is better than the HTC inspire, and about the same as the gs2 skyrocket (make sure to fully deplete the battery as soon as you get this phone. Then give it a 100% charge without taking it off the charger. Android OS needs to calibrate the battery.)- built in task manager works very well.- bottom app bar is customizable.- camera takes excellent pictures.- music player sounds great and is very responsive.- physical home button is nice to have- typing and playing games are both great experiences due to the huge, super responsive touch screen- Android 4.0.4 runs MUCH better on this device than it did on the galaxy S2 skyrocket- Shutter speed on the camera is very fast- I reliably(so-far) use the built-in clock/alarm app as my everyday wake-up alarm. The smart alarm feature is really cool too!- Comes with headphones with in-line controls. They are good for the gym, but the sound is a bit lean.CONS:- battery life still isn't as good as the iphone4. This is primarily with regards to standby time.- Touchwiz doesn't seem to have as many pretty widgets as htc sense, but I've found some 3rd party replacements (extended controls, beautiful widgets, etc)- no more touch-search-button (only menu, back, and home buttons now). I actually liked having that button.- phone is massive, so one-handed use is very difficult depending on what case you use.- S-voice is a joke, but you can use a different app...- Camera photo quality isn't quite up to par with apple's newer offerings, but is still very respectable.- Over a period of a few months, the samsung branded software keyboard will start to get VERY sluggish. I recommend downloading the stock ICS or Jellybean keyboard from the Google Market!OTHER:- I recommend the "Llama" app to setup cell phone tower profiles. When I enter my work's cell phone area, my phone automatically turns off wifi and gps, as well as mutes my phone. When I leave work my phone automatically turns my volume back on. When I get home I have it turn wifi on and gps off, and when I leave home it turns wifi off. VERY useful and it saves battery life.Honestly, this is the best phone I've ever used. Battery life may be a consideration for some people, but the micro USB charging port makes having (or borrowing) chargers pretty convenient. The size of the phone is awesome for me, but you may want something smaller.

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-04: I went from a Samsung S2 to the iPhone thinking I was going up in quality. Well.......I was very wrong. I have missed my Samsung phone so much that I went ahead and purchased the Samsung S3.......ANDthis was the smartest move I have made. I am hoping to own the Samsung Tab3 10.1 and 8.0 soon. I am wanting to wash my hands of Apple products.

    Rating: 5

    2012-12-31: I have been an iPhone fan for a long time and let me tell you that the Galaxy S3 blows the iPhone 5 out of the water. I was skeptical at first about the Galaxy S3 because I was not sure how it would compare against the iPhone 5 but there's no competition because the Galaxy S3 wins hands down. I was blown away by this phone and I can't stop using it everywhere I go. It easily lasts a full day with a single charge and there's always around 20% left at the end of the day which is nice.Even my family who has been using an iPhone since they first came out is blown away by this phone. I have even caught them using my phone when they thought I was sleeping because they just love the big screen and the customization that it has compared to the iPhone 5. There are many reasons why I chose this phone over the iPhone 5 but the main reason is the screen size and the battery. It got to the point where the iPhone was too small for my hands and I'd have to charge it at least four times a day.These are some things that the Galaxy S3 has over the iPhone 5 and other high end phones:Pros:-Screen: The Galaxy S3 has a nice 4.8 inch Super AMOLED screen that makes everything stand out when you see it. The resolution on this phone is a nice 720 x 1280 which makes every look sharp. It has a significantly higher resolution than the iPhone 5(640 x 1136). Also, the iPhone 5 is only 4 inches which is way to small for most people.-Android OS: This phone now ships with Android 4.1.2 (Jelly Bean) which is the fastest Android version yet. The phone feels way faster than Android 4.0.4 (ICS) thanks to project butter which makes the CPU work at a high frequency as soon as you touch the screen to reduce lag and slow downs.-Design: I was getting tired of the same design with the iPhone and the Galaxy S3's design is sexy and very comfortable to hold in your hand. It has a nice feel to it that makes you want to hold it.-Camera: The camera on this phone is super awesome and takes some of the best pictures I have ever seen. Even the front facing camera is great when you are Skyping or even taking pictures of yourself.-Battery: The battery wasn't that good with Android 4.0.4 (ICS) but with the release of Android 4.1.2 (Jelly Bean), the phone lasts me now 2x as long as before. I can get through a day with a single charge and I can still have 20% left at the end of the day.-Storage: With the option of an external sdcard, this phone simply destroys the iPhone 5. I can store as many pictures and HD videos as I want and it will never be full. I am the type of person who stores large collections of pictures and videos and this phone lets me do all of that easily. I also play games that require a minimum of 1GB space.-Processor: The Qualcomm Snapdragon S4 does an amazing job at keeping this phone lag free and blazing fast. I have never experienced a slow down with this phone. I have even tested this phone by playing GTA Vice City that was just released on the highest settings and there was no slow downs whatsoever. I was very impressed.-Removable Battery: Who doesn't love this? I always carry extra batteries whenever I travel somewhere and I can easily swap my battery with another one when the phone is low on battery. This is a big plus for this phone.Cons:-S Voice: Doesn't really work most of the time for me. I have to constantly repeat the same thing so it hears it correctly.-Fingerprint magnet: While this may bother some, this can easily be fixed by buying a case.Overall it's a great phone and doesn't disappoint. With the amazing high resolution and screen size, this phone puts other phones to shame. The Galaxy S3 is the best phone of 2012.

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-23: Just like the title says, ive never had a better phone. Love Android and Samsung. Im sure the S4 is great, but I got this for $10 new w an upgrade through ATT. Cant beat that!

    Rating: 5

    2012-07-27: Earlier this year I slipped off to Evo-land and had a great experience with the HTC Evo One X, but at the end of the day, AT&T;'s version of the One X was too limited: smaller space (16GB instead of 32), no added storage, sealed battery, too much pre-loaded junk, too much data-gobbling. I wasn't ready to live that much in the cloud.Thus far, the Galaxy S III has been the answer to all of my problems. It has none of the senility of my Galaxy I (which got really weird there at the end), it is far snappier than the Galaxy II I played with, and the Android 4.0 "Ice Cream Sandwich" OS has me giddy with its response time and smooth transition from one program to another. Yes, the Galaxy S III really can multi-task, and is happy to do so. Best of all, I slipped in my 32GB SD Card and we were ready to go. The HTC One X consumed just over 6GB of its built-in 16GB. This means an AT&T; Evo One X has only 9 GB of room. Out of the box, the Galaxy S III takes up a little over 4GB of the native 16, but will allow you to slot in an SD card of up to 64GB in size for even more room. If the battery stops holding a charge one day, I'll just open the case, pop it out, and put in a new one--how handy!I've seen some people have battery problems, but so far I've managed to go up to two days without having to charge. It all depends on what I'm doing, but even with what I consider to be heavy activity (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, several calls, lots of surfing), I don't have to charge the phone more than once a day.INTERFACE AND SETTINGSWith the Galaxy S III's interface, there are a LOT of options that let you customize your phone to be just as you want it: it's as if the makers of both the Galaxy III and the Droid OS decided to bend over backwards and hand you the keys to pretty much every feature you can think of. For example, if you hate eating data when someone e-mails you an attachment, you can set the phone to only pull down attachments when on Wi-Fi, or not at all. Check for new messages anywhere from 'continuous' to 'daily' to 'never' (which means 'manually'). Hotmail works much better now that Exchange is supported--my Galaxy I would take forever, drop out, freeze, or give me nagging, 'Too many requests' messages.Getting around is smooth swiping with the Gorilla Glass on the Galaxy S III's face, but I still went with a so-so Steinheil screen protector. Either way, SWYPEing is easier: not only is the onscreen keyboard huge, with the keys generously spaced wherever possible, but the SWYPE interface draws your swipe line cleanly and it is easy to see what word you are SWYPEing. Word suggest is still annoying--tap out the word "text" and get "Texas" inserted--but once I turned this off, everything else worked well. If there's one disadvantage to the Galaxy S III, it's that both the phone and the screen are a real fingerprint magnet: the Evo X picks up stains and smudges, but was just a bit better about not getting as much smeariness on the glass. Still, with either device the problem is solved by a quick swipe across your shirt.APPS AND WIDGETSAndroid phones now use the Google Play Store instead of the Droid Market and it works fairly well: enter your Google account info and you're ready to go. AT&T; customers still get CRapplications they can't remove, but your own third-party apps can also be side-loaded after changing one setting in the options. You can't root the phone (yet, anyway), but I'm not seeing the horrible performance drag of all that AT&T; stuff like I used to. I'm especially fond of the side-loaded Amazon App Store, which nimbly pushed all my apps down with no complaints, security warnings, or performance drops (take that, ol' Galaxy I!)Applications now come in two form factors: Apps and Widgets. When you tap the 'Applications' button from the home screen, the resulting screens are tabbed between a list of Applications and a list of Widgets. Think of an 'App' as meaning "An icon I tap to launch a program" and a 'Widget' as "A thing I may launch, or may just interact with at the screen and never need to open separately" (like the Weather, the media player, or the flashlight). When you swipe from one home screen to another, adding Widgets now gets a Windows Phone like twist: some widgets are double-wide like a Windows Phone 7 tile, and some (like the media player or the clock/weather on the main home screen) take up half the screen--the variety of sizes also resembles the coming Windows 8 Metro interface. Instead of feeling crowded, it reminds me of how much fun it was to play with my first desktop gadgets in Windows Vista.NETWORKING AND DATAWi-Fi and Bluetooth are very responsive: connecting to various networks or pairing is quick. If you connect to the type of network that requires you to open a browser and agree to something/provide a user ID before you can connect, the Galaxy S III will prompt you accordingly and automatically open the page you need. There is also a button right on the pull-down menu to turn off packet data so you can conserve your data plan--I like that feature VERY much.MULTIMEDIAMultimedia playback is excellent: while my Galaxy I would take quite a while to open and respond to me, the Media Player Widget makes my music quickly accessible. True to form, I get album art, artist/title/album searches, and a very good quality of playback over the included earbuds.CAMERAThe Galaxy S III has two cameras: one in the front and a much better one in the back. Both are for taking photos and shooting video. The camera on the back is for the serious picture-taking and has a very high-output flash for such a tiny LED. Picture-taking is so fast I find myself accidentally snapping multiple shots! The gallery of my Galaxy S I might take a while to show me newly-snapped photos, but with the S III they are not only instantly available, I can go straight into the Gallery from the Camera and not have to step out to the home screen. Flash can be adjusted on and off, switching cameras is as easy as tapping one icon, and there are a variety of easy-to-access options, from three focus modes (Auto, Macro, Face detection) to generic 'shooting mode' settings: Single shot, burst, HDR, "Smile Shot", Beauty, Panorama, Share Shot, and Buddy photo share. Settings includes the ability to adjust the exposure value, and what's more there are scene modes for sports, night, party/indoor, etc.CALLSThe feel of the Contacts and Phone Dialing interface haven't changed much, but the look certainly has: icons, contact pictures, and menus are larger on the Galaxy III's generous screen. I found myself making fewer mistakes trying to nudge and poke my way through the touchscreen when I needed to look up a contact or merge their information. Call quality is excellent, and answering the phone is easy. As with all new phones, there are many ringtones, alarms, and message sounds to choose from: I was very pleased with the variety of options this time around--the many sounds you can choose from for your calls range from soothing and tranquil to jarring and noisy.If you're looking for a new Android Smartphone, the Galaxy S III is a fantastic choice. Its screen is bright, colorful and generous, the OS runs smooth and fast and the screen is very responsive to touch. The number of features at times seems endless, but more importantly, Samsung have executed those features well: this is indeed a great phone.

    Rating: 5

Sure enough, there were mixes of colors emanating from the surface screen (green, violet,blue). And not to mention, the splash cover's front protector kept scratching myyyy ear every time I talked on the phone.So knowing GT Max's line of apple accessories (bought a protective keyboard mat for my macbook) I have come to rely on them as far as protecting my cherished electronic devices. We bought the item for 82 cents? And maybe a dollar shipping and it came in the mail almost the next day! The covers were front and back protection for the iPhone4 (same as the splash ones) but at a fraction of the cost. There was no gooey residue or adhesive and they were easy to install.There are no glares, no oily screens, no rainbow effects, no orange-peel feeling... Just a smooth, form-fitting screen protector at a great price. That's what I like about this product. It's simple, It does what it says its made for, and its price is justified! Highly recommend getting these before buying a more expensive alternative.

    A great description that explains what this product is all about. Here's what you get!

    2013-10-19: I was looking for a dry install screen protector for my Droid Maxx and found this item from iSmooth. The price was right so I gave them a try. I am quite pleased with my purchase. The item arrived quickly and in excellent condition, though in a humorously large box. Installation was simple and straightforward and the protector fits very well on my phone. The protector itself is nice and smooth with no sticky texture like some other brands I have tried in the past. There are three protectors in the package which is excellent, and it comes with a nice full-sized cleaning cloth. This is definitely a product I would buy again and that I would recommend.

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-29: Title says it all. The product is great-installs easily and results in a bubble and lint free screen; and I have always had trouble with installing screen protectors. Furthermore, what they include in the package for such a low price is truly amazing. The cleaning cloth is almost worth the cost of the order itself. I wouldn't waste any time shopping for a screen protector...just buy this one.

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-09: I've used Zagg screen protector in the past, but as Zagg doesn't offer a product to support my new phone I went looking for another product. After comparing other products I decided to give this one a try despite only having one review at the time. This was priced right, came with three protectors (I thought was great in case I screwed up the application, especially since I had two phones) and even had a lifetime guarantee (perfect should I mess up and ruin all three protectors).I did review the video's that ISmooth has on their website and I found these very helpful. The process is pretty straight forward, but watching it done, including how to use the dust removal tool, made the installation very easy. As long as you take your time and follow the instructions (straight forward and easy) the installation is pretty painless. The install for my first phone took me about 5 minutes. I took care to line up the product (as suggested in the video) and even though I took time to clean the screen (with the cloth included) I had a couple lint pieces on the screen that I had to remove. The dust removal tool made this very easy. What took the most time was I'd remove one piece of lint and then get another trapped. Practice makes perfect and applying the protector on the next phone took under a couple minutes (only one piece of lint to remove).The fit of this screen protector is really nice. It is also very smooth, by following the instructions there's not one bubble found and with my case on the phone I can't even tell there is a screen protector on it. Additionally I can't tell the difference of the touch of the screen. It's too early to tell how well the protector wears, but with the life guarantee this shouldn't be a problem as you can just get it replaced. I'll update my review once I have used this for a month or two.I would not hesitate to recommend this product.** UPDATE - After using this for a couple of days it still looks great. However I consider the design at the top of the screen protector to be slightly flawed. It doesn't cover the entire screen at the very top, it has a cut-out around the flash, ear piece and lens instead of individual cut-outs for each. The difference is when I swipe down from the top you feel the edge of the protector. If each had it's own smaller cut out (like I've seen on several other protectors for this phone) you wouldn't feel the edge of the protector when you swiped, or it would be a lot less noticeable.

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-21: One of the few screen protectors I have found for the MotoX that did a good job of covering the edge to edge screen! The film is good, to the point that I cannot tell it is there at all when the phone is on. In addition, while this product is NOT an anti-glare screen protector, I did notice a reduction of the glare on the phone after it was installed.Installation was fairly easy, largely because the product includes dust removal stickers - and not just any old stickers - these have an actual tab to hold on to, which makes them much easier to use than other protectors that come with either nothing for dust removal or simply come with a portion of a sticker sheet cut down.My only criticism was that the plastic covering the protector on the install side was a little overly sticky. When attempting to install screen protectors, I tend to peel the protective cover off as I apply the screen protector, so that dust doesn't have any time to get on the protector. When doing that with these protectors, a slight residue was left behind. That was easy enough to remove with the included microfiber cloth, but was awkward when it happened in the middle of the installation. That said, the directions say to remove the protective cover from the film side entirely before applying - which would have avoided the problem. I just like my method better, through years of experience with devices and screen protectors.Definitely a 5 star product!

I'm not sure why I want one, as my last Droid Razr M had Gorilla Glass and I beat the tar out of it with very few scratches, but I just did. I've tried lots of the cheap screen protectors, but am generally disappointed with how they make the image grainy, and quickly peel them off and toss them. This iSmooth protector is the real deal. Once on the phone, I saw ZERO difference in image quality. It is also simple to install.This company is top notch with customer service. They have multiple videos on how to install the protector, give you three of them in case you mess up, and have countless options of how to contact them if you have any problems. There is no question these guys at iSmooth care about building a business.As for the install, I was almost intimidated because of all the detailed instructions, thinking it must be tricky. It's not. At all. I just looked at this review and realize I STILL have the original protector on my phone, and it still looks great. That's 7 months with the same one. Pretty amazing.

I knocked off points for fit, primarily where, again, a lot of manufacturers fall short: the top where the camera and proximity and light sensors live. This protector misses by maybe a hair. The cut at the top needs to be maybe 1/16th of an inch bigger. Maybe even less. Regardless, the proximity sensor will over-react even if the film is barely on the edge. So the product is good but needs a little fine tune on the indent at the top.

After 6 months, all screen protectors look like garbage. That's why, I've started looking for protectors that offer the most realistic "glass" feel instead of buying based on how long I'll have it. I bought the iSmooth protectors for my Nexus 5 and honestly my wife asked me, about 2 weeks after I had them, if I was ever going to put a screen protector on my phone. I told her I already did. She looked really close and was like "WOW. That feels just like the glass screen". I just finished putting them on her new Moto X and it's the same thing. Fits perfectly and offers a "glass-like" feel. The fact that they give you 3 means you can use it till it gets scuffed up, then put on a new one. Best screen protectors... period.     A great description that explains what this product is all about. Here's what you get!

    2014-06-10: I've had these for about 8 months before the left earbud stopped working.     2013-11-13: I really wanted to like these... but I cant for the following reasons:1) The first thing I noticed was that they don't produce very good volume. At max it wasn't enough to get immersed into the music, and I'm not even the kind of person to blast it to the max normally, there just isn't enough volume there. To me they go up to what other normal headphones probably put out at about 50% volume. On my phone and tablet I used an application to boost the sound and it helped but its an inconvenience but it still wasn't all there, maybe up to 70%.2) Volume aside, the quality of the sound was OK, but don't expect a nice bass out of them by any means.3) For some reason they disconnect sometimes by themselves, or the music stops and I have to disconnect the Bluetooth myself to get it to play again. I ruled out my playing device as being at fault since this doesn't happen with a different Bluetooth receiver product that I have. (Same way I can narrow down the volume problem to these headphones)4) I knew the charger was proprietary before I ordered, which was at that time the point I disliked the most of these headphones, but whatever I still went for them based on other descriptions... The charger broke just a couple of days after I got them, now what?? Without any harsh type of use whatsoever. Cant use the headphones anymore.5) The description said that I could connect to 2 devices at the same time but I was never able to do this though I tried with 2 devices to which I could easily connect independently. Tried turning off the 'phone' connection on the tablet and then attempting the second connection with my phone but nothing.6) They never actually fell out but the fit doesn't feel so secure, probably could have had better sound quality with a better fit though I'm not sure by how much. If I barely touch them they do disengage enough to deteriorate the sound quality. Tried different bud sizes and the stabilizers.7) And I didn't get to test this enough to be sure but I think people have a hard time hearing me through the mic on calls.Sounds like a scathing review but I had to put my experience out there.** UPDATE ************************************************************As noted by others, their customer service is extraordinary, and they sprung to action to make things alright for me. Literally its the best of any brand I've known. I would try again their products sometime in the future regardless of what happened to me with this one item. I do think that they will work to come up with improvements to their products and wish them luck with that.

    Rating: 2

    2013-11-06: I'm the happy owner of a half-dozen or so Anker products. Their customer service is the best. I desperately wanted to love these earbuds, but the problems I had with them were enough to cause me to return them. The sound quality is okay. The battery life is fantastic. The fact that they're Bluetooth LE compatible is awesome. However, the cons include:* Occasionally the audio would drop out for a second, even when my phone was just a couple of feet away.* The volume is too low. Inside a quiet room it was fine, but when I stepped outside or inside a restaurant, I'd have to crank up volume on the phone and the earbuds all the way up, and it still wasn't what I'd call loud.* It only came with a cable, not a wall plug. That meant that I'd have to swap out the cable for one of my existing USB wall plugs or buy another one.* The charging cable is too short (about 1.5 feet).* The charging cable uses a proprietary clip to attach to the earbuds. That means that if the cable gets damaged or lost, I'd have no way of charging the earbuds. It also means that I'd have to carry the charging cable everywhere with me, for those moments when the batteries suddenly die. I wish the earbuds simply accepted a standard microUSB plug; I have a bunch of those laying around all over the house, office, and car.* The buds didn't stay in my ears, even with the flat rubber "wings" that came with them. The right bud, particularly, would come loose. I'd have to keep pushing them back into my ear.* Player controls weren't intuitive to operate. Tapping the "+" and "-" buttons work as you'd expect to control volume. However, to rewind audio you have to long-press the "+" button, and to fast-forward the audio you long-press the "-" button. Those should be reversed.I hope they go back to the drawing board on this one, because it's got good potential. If they simply added a microUSB port, I wouldn't mind it if they got rid of the charging cable altogether.

    Rating: 2

    2013-11-22: Big disappointment in microphone quality. Good sound, good battery life but they're unusable fore calling because no one can hear you. The microphone quality is horrible, inbound or outbound calling, the microphone is so weak these can be used for headphones only. I'd like to get this fixed because I like the overall design and fit.** Update 1 ** I was contacted by the Anker support team to work on getting return or replacement. Their support team is very good and have helped me through issues I had with one of their batteries.I hope this works out like the batteries and USB hub I have. Their batteries are solid and a great value and the USB hub is very fast and charges even high demand tablets.

    Rating: 2

    2013-11-13: After reading some positive reviews, I decided to get these. I had the LG Tone+ before, and those just didn't last. So, I thought these would be better and last longer than 6 months. But they didn't even last a whole day! First off, the review by Anker's Power User Program(Anker sends users a product to be reviewed), they are totally misleading. I was sold by a video review from a Power User. The review stated,"The headset are lightweight and you'll barely know you're wearing them." Wrong, they are heavy especially the left side.The range of the headset are terrible! When my LG Tone+ were working right, I could leave my phone in my room and walk across the house w/ music playing and NOT lose a connection. W/ the Anker Bluetooth, I can't even walk down the hall w/out the music cutting in and out. It's even worst if you're a runner or want to use these w/ an arm band. I decided to return these after I went out for a run. Another review had this same exact problem. I wear my armband on my left arm and the music kept cutting in and out. My phone is less than 2 feet away from the bluetooth and it's losing connection? So, I switched arms and it sort of solved it. It also cuts in and out if you try to use the controls to change it to the next track. I don't know why it does that. But it just made me more angry. So, after finishing my run and I put them back the box and schedule for a UPS Pick up to get them out of my house. I never been so frustrated w/ a product. I also read from a reviewer that Anker connected them and he received another pair w/ the same issue. Honestly, I don't want another pair. I just want a decent pair of Bluetooth headphones so I don't have to get tangled w/ my headphone wire on my run. Some people like them, but for me, I really want to give it 0 stars.

    Rating: 1

    2013-09-09: In my estimation this is a breakthrough product category and one of those things that is a "must have". Why you may ask, since there are headphones, earphones, ear buds and other listening devices of nearly every size, shape, price and function.Because these are the first I would call "Stuffables". Unlike virtually every wired and wireless headphone made, these are the first to be rugged enough to pull out of your ears and just throw into your pocket or purse along with your keys, pocket change and anything else. Unlike other earbuds that use frail thin wires that tangle if you look cross-eyed at them, the Anker buds use a thick flat rubber cable that looks like it would survive a ride in the washing machine (DON'T try it), and no matter what I do I can't get them to tangle.There is precious little excess in these buds ... two slightly large earpieces, a short (thank you!) cable that hangs under or behind your neck with an extremely slender control pod. Hidden somewhere is a microphone with noise-reduction that's reasonably close to your mouth. Charging is done with a small clip-on plug that is equally light and portable for mobile use. And not to stop there, Anker has thoughtfully supplied additional tabs that virtually "glue" the earbuds to your ears for sports like bike riding, jogging, etc.Why are these "must have"? Consider the ways I have found to use them. Seriously it's a wonder they ever leave my ears:1. They are so small, easy to use and convenient I now use them to listen to virtually everything on my smartphone rather than through the tinny speaker, with the added bonus they are ready instantaneously to use as a talk/listen headset that tremendously helps block out external noise and make talking on my phone a joy, even in noisy airports.2. As good as the internal speakers are getting in tablets/eReaders these simply sound better and are the most perfect earbuds I have ever found for watching a movie on an airplane.3. When I am at my desk I now use them to listen to the audio from my desktop and my laptop the vast majority of time, but especially at night when I want to crank it up without disturbing those around me.4. Ditto for watching TV. A simple Bluetooth adapter on my home entertainment amp actually allows me to listen to any source while walking around, feeding the pets, watering the lawn, you get the idea. I can even follow the game on TV from the back yard by looking through the window at the TV from time to time during a big play. It's important to note for a use like this that Anker allows simultaneous connection with two devices to play music on one device and take a call on the other.5. While I don't use an iPod as much anymore because all that's built in to my phone and tablet, there is a tiny Bluetooth adapter for that too, where I can toss the player in my pocket and listen wire-free.Let me repeat the word "toss". There is no stereo headset I have ever seen that is so easy to simply shut off and stuff into my pocket (hence, Stuffable). When the flight attendant is giving me the evil eye to shut off ALL devices, no longer do I have to carefully stow away a pair of headphones, I just stuff the Ankers into my jeans, ready to go the instant the warden gives me the green light.They are comfortable. Battery life is reasonable at about 7 hours and they are rugged. They sound great. Bass is deeper than the average earbuds, high-end is tight and the mid-range (important for dialogue in movies and for cell phone talk) is clear. Unlike some other earbuds I've tried which have to be adjusted perfectly to get the "sweet spot", these are not as picky about exact placement in your ears. I also like that there are NO operating buttons on the earbuds themselves so there is zero risk of mistakenly hanging up or doing something you don't want to while adjusting the buds in your ears.Bottom line ... I got these direct from the manufacturer to provide evaluation and feedback. That had no influence on this or any review I write. Be aware that success with Bluetooth products is not always the same for everyone. I've had a higher-than-usual interest in Bluetooth technology for a long time (which is one reason I tested these) and have had my share of disappointments. Bluetooth gets better all the time and I don't doubt that these earbuds represent some of the most current technology available.

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-12: Excellent Bluetooth earbuds. They have good sound quality and are light enough to wear at the gym. Charging is extremely simple. I highly recommend these to someone looking for a good set of Bluetooth earbuds.

    Rating: 5

    2013-09-09: So, first a disclaimer: I received this product for free to review. That said, I am really happy with it, with only a few minor pain points (later). I am using this with both my iPod nano and my HTC One.Comfort: Very light, good cable length, and comfortable ear pillows (several are included, and some of the comply foam tips are also compatible).Audio quality: The bluetooth audio is outstanding - quality is about as good as a pair of Shure E3cs. This is probably helped by the apt-X audio codec support.Construction: cables seem reasonably thick and there's good strain relief.Support: Every time I have ever had a problem with an Anker product, the support folks there have always bent over backwards to assist.OK, here's why I knocked off a star:Control: there is a builtin inline control pod with up/down and multifuntion switch. There are symbols build in to the rubber coating, but it can be hard to get to them quickly. Perhaps long use would help?Voice quality: Given that there is nothing in the way of a mic that visible, much less particularly close to your mouth, it is almost surprising to realize that these can be used to speak. Anyway, the speech quality is not great (according to the people I called) and there's even a small echo. Still, when the main thing is to sit and listen to tunes on the phone, the ability to answer calls without scrambling is great and, for that kind of casual use it's fine. If you want perfect clarity, get a wired headset or at least something like a Plantronics Voyager.Charging: It's kind of annoying that this comes with a proprietary charging cable. You cannot use a regular microusb charger for this. Instead, you get something like a vampire clamp that you have to get on just right -- and you have to make sure to have it around. I hate having extra cables.In summary: This is a great device if you have a bluetooth audio device like a new iPod Nano or smartphone. I would certainly recommend it, though I would suggest you be careful not to lose the charging cable. Also, be careful with the earbud covers - they have a tendency to pop off.

    Rating: 4

    $B00IA8Z4R8

    A great description that explains what this product is all about. Here's what you get!

    2014-02-16: Finally! Someone has done the obvious thing and created a nearly invisible protective case for the iPhone. This isn't like any case I've seen yet and I've seen a lot of them. This slips on easily, protects completely, the holes line up perfectly but you don't see it! All you see is your beautiful iPhone. And it's thin!I wonder why no one that I've seen has done this before. I was so tired of thick rubbery cases that not only hide the beauty of my phone but make it much thicker. I don't care how nice the color is or how well they fit, they wreck the esthetics of my iPhone.This has the little protective lip that hooks around the edge. It comes in a perfectly clear plastic box. You see right through the package immediately, to emphasize that this is see through. As far as hand feel goes, it is a cross between rubbery and hard plastic. It's the best of both worlds and gives just a small amount of gripiness while feeling as if it will be scratch resistant.Did I say it's thin? It adds the smallest amount of thickness I've seen yet. This is the no case case. It is as close as you're going to get to going caseless. This is one of my rare ten star products.Thank you Ailet for providing me with a free sample!

    Rating: 5

    2014-02-27: The Ailet clear and flexible case for the iPhone 5 and 5s is perfect for those who need a little protection, desire a simple case, and want to be able to see and appreciate the iPhone’s clean design.The case is very easy to install and remove. It simply stretches over the phone and falls into place. It has a secure fit without being too tight.The bezel that runs around the front of the case is very slim and does not interfere with the screen or the home button. There are cut outs on the case’s bottom to accommodate the iPhone’s ports, speaker, and microphone. Another cut out is on the side for the mute switch, with one on the back that accommodates the camera and flash. The lock button and the volume buttons have covers molded into the case that do not interfere with the buttons’ operation.In use the case adds decent grip to the iPhone with it’s rubber construction and offers moderate protection. This is not a case for someone who will be giving the iPhone to a young child to play with, or someone who tends to drop their iPhone a lot. It works best for those who are careful with their phones but want some protection from the wear and tear of daily life and the occasional fall. A little bit of dust works its way under the case with use, but the case has not discolored or cracked in any way.All in all… the perfect case for those who like to keep it simple.(I received a complimentary sample of this product from the manufacturer in exchange for an unbiased review.)

    Rating: 4

    2014-02-19: This is a simple soft plastic case that has been manufactured to the precise dimensions of the Apple iPhone 5/5S. The plastic is flexible enough so that it is easy to slide the phone into it and once inside the case looks like it was part of the original package. Since the plastic is soft, it is hard to scratch or chip, keeping it transparent longer than harder plastic cases that don't have comparable give. It also wipes off very easily. There are also notches and cutouts for access to data ports and the charger.A simple item that can help protect your phone without changing the fundamental aesthetics, this case is inexpensive insurance to protect your iPhone.

    Rating: 5

    2014-02-14: This is a very simple case, but it's great. And for such a low price, it's hard to beat. I've been using aLifeProofcase that my kids gave me as a gift. Many charging cables don't fit through the case, ditto for the earphone port.I love the free access that this case provides.     2014-02-10: iPhone is one of my favorite products, both in terms of its functionality and look. Because of its beautiful design I hate putting it inside of a protective case. Over the years I've gone back and forth with using cases for the iPhones I've owned. In my first hand experience iPhone is much better at withstanding scratches, bumps and impacts than the much cheaper quality Android phones, but it's still not immune to them.AILET minimalist transparent case is probably as close as you'll ever get to an iPhone case that still allows for the beauty of the phone to be seen. It's very simply designed, fits snuggly on your iPhone, and leaves total access to all of iPhone's ports and buttons. The case was easy to install. TPU is a soft material that is reasonably nice to touch, but it will make your iPhone feel more plasticky than its elegant metal and glass exterior.One problem that I have with a transparent case, which may not be much of an issue initially, is that all smartphone cases, no matter how snug they may seem, eventually manage to trap some dirt and dust. This will probably mean that you'll have to open up this case every once in a while (perhaps once every one to two months) and wipe the phone and the case.

    2014-03-06: I really liked this case, but it is not one for everyone. I’ve always been a pretty tough customer when it comes to protection for my iPhone. I’ve always been OCD when it comes to protecting my expensive too often used iOS device. That is why I’m a diehard Otterbox fan and nothing is going to change that.So why did I want to try out this case? I thought this would be a case that I would take out for a night on the town when I don’t want to have a bulky thing in my pocket. (That sounds so first world huh?) And I was right. This is a very nice case… as long as you aren’t looking for a ton of protection. The fit is snug and the material feels nice in your hands. Very nice actually. The buttons are accessible and easy to manipulate.But as I was testing this case out and going about my day to day business, I found myself being a little too careful because I didn’t have the protection that I normally did. No fault of the manufacturer, but I would not use this as my everyday case. Like I said earlier, I would use this case when I go on a date with my wife, an evening book signing, or another classy outing. It’s a very simple yet very stylish case that gives your iPhone a good look with minimal protection.If you like to have your iPhone shine with very covering then I think you will like this case. If you protect your iPhone like you protect your children… wait that sounds bad. If you protect your iPhone like you protect your footsie-wootsies in a rain storm, then this would make a good second case, but not your primary.

    Rating: 4

    2014-02-24: Between my wife and I, we've had 5 different iPhones with a variety of cases over the years. The AILET Crystal Clear Soft Case for the iPhone 5/5S is a nice bumper case so long as you don't have a screen protector on the phone. If you use a screen protector I don't recommend this case since it pushes against the edges of the screen protector causing sides to bubble up. It's the first time my wife or I have had this problem with a case.PROS:1. The AILET provides a good balance between thickness and protection. It's thick enough to protect the iPhone if dropped or knocked but thin enough that the phone still retains its sleek design. The AILET case replaced a Spigen Saturn case my wife was previously using on her 5S. While the Saturn case is ultra thin it doesn't provide protection outside of scuffs and scratches. Within a couple weeks of using the Saturn case, her iPhone was dinged and dented in a couple of areas. The AILET provides much better protection than the Saturn case.2. Minimalist design. Except for AILET's logo on the side, the case is completely transparent with no tinting or additional designs. I like the simple design better than the Amazon Basic cases we've used in the past which have geometric designs on the back. The iPhone fits firmly inside the case. The case has a nice feel with its smooth back and beveled sides.CONS:1. Pushes against edges of the screen protector causing sides of screen protector to completely bubble up. AILET case should either wrap around more so it overlaps the screen protector or less so there is a small gap between the screen protector and the case. As it is, the case is flush with the screen protector. After using the case for about 6 weeks, 3 of the 4 sides of the screen protector were completely bubbled up. It's a very big problem.2. Headphones need to have a slim jack to be able to plug into the phone with the bumper case on. This is pretty common but still worth noting. While my earbud headphones have no problem plugging into the iPhone, my Audio Technica M50 headphones are not able to plug into the iPhone with the AILET case on.SUMMARY:The AILET is a simply designed bumper case that provides a good balance between thickness and protection but I don't recommend this case if you use a screen protector. My wife had the same screen protector on her 5s when using the Saturn case and didn't have an issue with it pushing up the edges of the screen protector. I have the same make/model screen protector on my iPhone 5c with an i-Blason case and don't have an issue either. With the Saturn and i-Blason case I can see a small gap between the case and screen protector which isn't there with the AILET. Sadly, we are going to have to buy another case for the 5s and install another screen protector.Note: A product sample was provided by the seller in exchange for a fair, unbiased review.

    2014-02-24: My iPhone5 slipped easily into this transparent, very nice, transparent case. ALL buttons and lenses are useable and unencumbered - the iPhone sits snugly inside. It doesn't obscure the logo or anything else.One nice unadvertised "feature" is the ability to print and cut your own graphic or photo and insert inside the back part of the cover. You can probably do this with any cover where the back is transparent, but I'm quite proud of my Krusty the Clown customization. I used a hobby knife to cut out a space in the paper of my printed graphics in order to also display the Apple logo.     2014-03-08: There’s no point in paying up for the design and features of an Apple smartphone and then putting it into a clumsy case that spoils the experience.This Minimalist case from Ailet for iPhone 5 and 5s provides an easy-to-grip skin that gives protection from bumps and scratches while preserving all the the function and the appearance of the iPhone.This case goes on easily and fits perfectly, but can be removed quickly if necessary.     Rating: 5

    2014-03-12: AILET was kind enough to send me a case for review.The first impression was that the case fits so snugly and perfectly on the iPhone that it feels as though it should have been part of the base design. Because of its transparency, it allows the basic appearance of the iPhone to shine through without dulling or making it look "ugly" as some other cases tend to do. It feels like a more durable version of the bumper that Apple used to give away due to "Antennagate".There are cover-style pieces for the buttons, including the power and volume buttons, and a cutout for the speakers and charging port on the bottom. The speaker cutout was not perfectly aligned with the speaker holes, but the charging hole was lined up nicely.At first, pressing the power button seemed to be a bit more challenging because it forces you to press the button squarely in the middle. Most long-term iPhone users are accustomed to being able to press either side of the button to get it turn on; it's easy to press so you can quickly get to what you need. The power button cover on the AILET case does not allow for this, and it takes some getting used to. In some ways this is a positive design: it prevents you from accidentally pressing the button when you didn't intend to, powering on the screen and draining the battery unnecessarily.There were two nitpicks observed. First, the edge of the case where it was apparently sealed feels sharp to the touch; not to the point of cutting, but it's apparent when holding the device for calls. If you're a leftie, it's a plus: it helps you hold the phone as it rests comfortably in your thumb. If you're a rightie, it'll be slightly annoying as it will rest in your finger joint and possibly get uncomfortable after a lengthy phone call.Second was that the phone is not matte or patterned, which means it was prone to slipping out of the hand slightly easier than the phone without the case. Again, if you're a leftie, this likely won't be an issue.If you're trying to get something that protects the edges of your device and is raised enough to help protect the front and back of an otherwise fragile device, BUT is not unattractive and retains the appearance of the iPhone, consider this case.

    Rating: 5

    2014-02-12: This may be minimalist, but it's not minimal. For one thing the claim of precise fit is valid. It may seem like an easy thing to accomplish, but judging from other cases that I have tested and reviewed for the iPhone 5S it apparently isn't.The fit of this case, including access to buttons, ports and features is perfect. What I love is the case, which is made from thermoplastic polyurethane and does, indeed, absorb shocks. In fact I wish I could find such a case for my Galaxy Note 3 phone.As for the claim that this is 'crystal clear' all I can say is it's so transparent that it does not look like you have a case protecting your phone. The advantage is not just the look, but the fact that this case does not appreciably add to the size of your phone, and the weight difference is nominal.One final thing that I love about this case is the lip that goes around it us slightly curved inward. It's slightly raised above the screen, so your phone may survive a fall on a flat surface.If there is a single improvement that I would like to see it's a slightly enlarged cutout for the charging cable. This perfectly fits Apple's OEM cable, but there are some aftermarket cables that are a tad too large to properly seat. Of course, that is the fault of the cable manufacturer and not this case, which is perfect for genuine Apple parts.

    2014-02-28: Four and a half ATTRACTIVE Stars! The AILET Minimalist Original Crystal Clear iPhone 5/5S Soft Transparent Case is a lightweight (.7 ounce), not-waterproof, flexible, transparent case for the iPhone 5 which protects the sides, corners, and back of the phone from incidental contact, with a recessed front that keeps the face of the iPhone5/5S from touching the surface if the front of the iPhone is face down. The transparency allows the colors of the instrument to be seen. All ports, controls, front and back cameras, and speakers are uncovered and accessible. The volume up and down controls are covered by plastic buttons, and respond perfectly when pushed. The plastic is sturdy and fits the iPhone5/5S with no gaps. When I tested the strength by repeatedly taking the empty case and pushing the sides together until they touched, top-to-bottom and side-to-side, the case springs back into its original shape. If an air pocket develops when 'popping' the iPhone into the case, it can be pushed out easily. Only a protective face cover would have made this a perfect, non-charging, all-over iPhone 5/5S cover. This 'pop in, pop out' AILET transparent, plastic, iPhone protective case is attractive, functional, and Highly Recommended! Four and a half SLEEK Stars! (60 day "no questions asked" warranty. This item was provided by the manufacturer for testing and an impartial, non-mandatory review.)

    2014-02-24: By way of disclosure, I received an offer to receive a free version of this product to evaluate. I usually turn such offers down, but I was actually looking for a light, unobtrusive iPhone 5 case, so here we are. This is a nice case! It adds very little bulk to your iPhone 5 (letting you enjoy the small size of the phone) but protects the back and sides. It also provides a lip for the front so that if you invert your iPhone 5 on a desk or some other surface the screen is protected from scratching. This case is designed to protect your iPhone from everyday use; it is not going to protect it from water or the elements the way more bulky cases may do. The thing I like about this case is that it allows the nifty look of the iPhone to be on display, and it allows me to slip the iPhone 5 into my jacket pocket without bulking the phone up and without a grabby rubbery surface. Use this case in conjunction with one of those stick-on screen protectors and you will have a nice little setup for your iPhone. By the way every charger I've tried works with this case; you do not have to remove the case as is so with some chargers. Recommended. RJB.

    2014-02-17: This is a solid, affordable, well designed and great fitting case. I prefer a light weight case, but often the ones that look crystal/jelly like this have a sticky/tacky feeling to them that makes them extremely difficult to get in/out of the pocket. This one does not have that problem.It is not sticky, yet is still compliant/pliable enough that it will absorb some of the shock if you drop the phone. It's more precisely fit and easier to install/remove than any other case I've used.The holes for headphone & charging are big enough to work well, and accommodates third part cables like Amazon brand charging cables which have proven to be an issue for some people.Fully recommended and no issues/problems with this case.By a lot of hard hours and days and years of time spent reviewing, I found myself in the top 10 reviewers on Amazon.     Rating: 5

    2014-02-15: When the iPhone 5S came out, there were lines around the block and a long wait, especially for the gold one. My daughter's is gold, and with a traditional case, all that showed of it was the gold ring around the buttons. If you pay for a nice looking phone and want people to see it, this is the case for you.The case is well made and does a good job protecting the phone. The material is flexible enough that it doesn't interfere with pressing buttons at all. The sides are slightly thinner than other cases I have. All similar cases will allow a certain amount of movement if you touch the side portions near the screen, and this allows slightly more. That's neither a positive nor a negative per se, and has nothing to do with the quality of the case. But it did mean that I had to remedy a badly aligned screen protector. The overall thickness is perfect, and will keep the phone from sliding away.The bottom of the case has less open space than some others I have, offering slightly more protection, but potentially less compatibility. This case works fine with standard accessories such as authorized iPhone cables. There are some docking stations that won't work with any case, and this is no exception. But there are some accessories that are in between, such as aftermarket cables. This all boils down to other components not being compatible with Apple specs rather than the case being at fault, but it's something to keep in mind when you buy other accessories. Genuine ones work best. The AmazonBasics lightning compatible cable's description gives a warning that it might not be compatible with certain cases, and with this one you have to be extra careful to get it to make contact, but you won't have to remove this case to do so. I used it with aZeetron Light Up Lightning USB Cableand had to be extra careful to get things to seat, but the affect was amazing. Since the cable tip lights up, the case transmitted the light much the way a fiber optic cable does, and gave a pleasant red glow while the the phone was charging, which switched to a turquoise glow when the phone was charged. Other people in my daughter's dorm thought that made the case the coolest thing ever.What was more surprising is the reaction it got. I didn't expect that a clear minimalist case would garner many comments, but it proved to be very popular. That was especially true among male college students.Note: I was sent a sample of this case, but no review was promised in exchange. Opinions are my own, but were influenced by the positive reaction this case got from others.

    2014-07-16: Glad to finally get to try out a tempered glass screen protector to see if the hype is well deserved. The price is really what won me over.Pros:--------Feels legit, meaning that this doesn't feel like a hard film, but a sliver of glass.-For someone who has oily disgusting fingers no matter how hard I try to wash and dry them out, this screen lives up to its oleophobic claims- The thickness is great, its just barely thicker than a normal PET screen protector. When on the home button becomes nearly (if not) flush with the glass. Which I kind of really like, since I know where the home button is that I don't need that tactile reminder.-This doesn't mess with tight form fitting cases thanks to the glass's absurd thinness-It feels like the screen is more sensitive with this protector on over my PET film.-When ON the screen looks gorgeous, better than with the protector off-Rather easy install, nothing got trapped under the glass while applying it which was a miracle in itselfCons:---------There is some heavy rainbowing going on when the screen is OFF-The glass is kind of on the small side, which might be so that it works with different tight cases, but not too small and the cut outs are perfect.     Rating: 1

    2014-07-17: for Samsung Galaxy S4 international model: This worked great. easiest application yet. i am too impatient to make a big production and other high end glass screen protectors have resisted a hurried approach. I've ruined any number of protectors having to ask the manufacturers for replacements (which they do send). i read another buyer's review about this product- they just plopped it on and it worked so, like an idiot i tried that method...and it worked! OMG. I was astounded. Laid it down on a flat plastic tablecloth. no special prep. used alcohol wipe followed by included cloth drying/cleaning. I took off the adhesive as instructed holding the glossy side up/sticky side down and used the tips of my fingers to align it with the edges and carefully let it slide down my fingers onto the glass. it sat perfectly. so i pressed once in the middle and like magic it adhered from the center to the edge leaving only a few air bubbles. i massaged those out with the cloth easily and it looked perfect. you can't tell it's on. no dust and no bubbles. screen is so bright and beautiful, unchanged touch sensitivity. I love this and would use it again. Only caveat is it's brand new so I don't know about long term performance.

    2014-06-05: I had read about the glass screen protectors and decided to give it a go. I purchased this brand because of the reviews and it doesn't disappoint! the box alone was probably half the cost because it gave quite a presentation with a hint of the quality inside. The protector itself was a bit thicker than I expected.For installation you do have to make sure you are in a dust free environment and clean the screen carefully. Handle the screen by the sides so as not to get oil/dirt from your fingertips on the adhesive side. It is much easier to line up than the flimsy plastic screen protectors. I was able to just line it up with the home screen button and drop it down. Getting rid of the "bubbles" just takes a few minutes of slow, even pressure as you push it to the sides. At first I was worried about the smaller looking bubbles but within an hour it completely evened out and disappeared. The surface is slick and even and the touch screen is perfectly responsive. I do find the fingerprint scan is a little more difficult but I think with a few scans I'll get the feel of it.I like it, a lot. The wear and tear will determine if I continue to like. If I run into any issues I'll update my review.

    Rating: 5

  • B00JLQU9DC

    $B00JLQU9DC

    A great description that explains what this product is all about. Here's what you get!

    2014-06-08: I can use this for my IPhone and my Galaxy Note II as long as they don't have cases which have any sort of recessed opening. I sometimes use a battery case for my Iphone and since it uses the mini USB it works great with this - or I just leave my Iphone naked and plug on in. The cord is pretty short - but worked fine in my car where I find the most need for it. I run and do races and so sometimes, when I'm on a trail race and I've used my phone for apps and for keeping track of me with GPS the battery runs down quickly. This thing is super convenient to have and lets me charge up right there in the care with my USB port. So far it's been tossed about on my keychain for a little while and is pretty sturdy. I gave 4 stars because I'm a tad bit worried about longevity with the hippo's mouth not shutting all the way - and my stuff goes through a lot of dirt being on trails so much. So far though, as indicated, all good and so much character :)Disclaimer: I received this product in exchange for an honest review.

    Rating: 4

    2014-06-22: If you have ever been caught without a USB charging cable for your iPhone, you will appreciate this little gizmo. It will never be your everyday cable, but in a pinch, it might come in very handy.=== The Good Stuff ===* It is small. It its "stored" configuration, it is 1 7/8" x 1 1/8" x 3/16". Easily small enough to keep on a keychain, and it has a hole cut in for just this purpose. It weighs 0.2 ounces, barely enough to notice. When extended, the cord is roughly 4" long, just enough to connect between a USB port and an iPhone.* The connector fit well into the iPhone 30 pin connector and a USB port, providing a snug fit both times. It seemed to charge in the "normal" amount of time. I was unable to sync my iPhone using this cable- the rear panel of the package says it will "charge", so that may be expected behavior.=== The Not-So-Good Stuff ===* The plastic of this in 3/8" thick, which means that it is a big of a struggle to get on and off a keychain. The cord is so short that using it while attached to my car keys was problematic. The struggle to get this on and off a keychain ruined some of the convenience, although that could be solved with some sort of easy-separate keychain- something like people use for a valet key.* When putting the cord back into the case, you have to remember to put the USB connector in first, otherwise it won't go together. it resulted in a few choice words until I remembered the secret.=== Summary ===* While it may not be the 100% most convenient design, if you need one of these cables in a pinch, this isn't a bad thing to have on hand. Rather than my keychain, I ended up putting it on a loop of string inside my computer bag, attaching it to one of the many metal loops. While I won't use it everyday, I am sure someday it will prove itself very useful, especially considering the small weight and size penalty for carrying it.

    Rating: 4

    2014-06-07: This is a good idea for people who often find themselves needing a short charging cable for micro USB or Apple Lightening devices. I tried it with my iPad mini and Android smartphone and it worked fine with both, though one issue you may run into is difficulty plugging it into devices that have large cases that interfere with the plug.The variety of colors this is available in is also a plus, and the material feels durable and of good quality.I do wish they provided some instructions and illustrations with it, but it's not too hard to figure out how to get the cable out and use it. When done charging, put (by pushing) both connectors back in the hippo for protection and to hide them (pulling on the keyring may be helpful as well).You probably wouldn't want to use this as your regular charging cable, but it's a great idea for anyone who often wants or needs a charging cable and finds that they don't have one immediately available... so for that reason I am rating it 4 stars (but if this doesn't apply to you (i.e. you hardly ever find yourself in need of such cabling), then this key chain may be of little use to you). I decided to deduct one star due to potential problems with the plug design and not easily being able to plug (fit) the cables into some devices with large cases.NOTE: I was sent a free product sample for review.

    2014-06-09: This is a very cleverly-designed little USB cable. The flashing colors make it easily seen (I happen to have a yellow copy) and the six-inch cable is just long enough to be carried as a key chain or other short mobile cable.I can not speak for its durability, but this soft rubber outer cover does keep some dust and dirt off the cable openings.     2014-06-30: *Disclosure: I was contacted by a rep for Zeetron and provided a free sample for the purposes of giving my thoughts on it.*Ok, whoever decided this item was a hippo needs to have a look at a cow, because seriously, it looks far more like a cow than a hippo. Dual function in that it works with most every iOS and Android device. I'd call it an emergency cable, given that it's fitted with a key ring and the cord length is tiny. Not something I'd want to use every day, but would work in a pinch.     2014-06-08: This cute little keychain is perfect for young kids and maybe some adults. It's basically a multi-function cable that has USB on one end and lightning and micro USB on the other end. The cable is wrapped up inside a cute little blue Hippo that is made of silicone. It's really quite adorable and I think most kids would get a kick out of it.The cable itself is about 6 inches long when not in use it's held inside the Hippo.     Rating: 5

    2014-07-03: This is an adorable cable, whoever came up with this idea is genuinely creative. This is a short microUSB / Apple Lightning cable stuffed inside the head of a hippopotamus. Go figure, a hippopotamus.Cute design aside, this is a good solid cable. The flat cable is made with really thick insulation. The cable ends are big and rubbery, so they will take a lot of abuse. The input side of the cable (the rectangular USB plug) looks big but in fact is just about the standard size for a cable end. You shouldn't have space issues with the connector. The business end is another story - they insulation is also big and rubbery. There are two connectors on that one end and they are in a Y formation. If you have a thick case, this connector might not work. If the connectors were 90 or 180 degrees apart, case thickness might not be a problem.OK, on to the fun part of this cable. When you take it out of the package, the hippo head is pulled down over the connector ends, and a key ring is visible. You slide the hippo head toward the key ring. Once the ends are visible, simply grab them and pull them apart. The hippo head will slide up over the key ring and allow you to use the cable straightened out. With the hippo head on the key ring, it looks like a frog that is grabbing lunch.This is an adorable cable that works well if you don't have a thick case.I was provided a review sample.

    Rating: 5

    2014-06-18: This cable is sooooo clever!This is a short cable with a USB connector on one end and two connectors on the other end: micro USB and Lightning for Apple devices. All this is bundled up in a keychain with a cute hippo head on it. What a clever way to ensure that you have your two most-used cables with you at all times.The first thing I noticed when I tried this out is that I didn't get the nagging message telling me that the cable isn't compatible with my Apple device. Most of my Lightning cables are cheap third-party knock offs. I've gotten used to this annoying message; it's fine with me as long as the cable actually charges my phone. But I'm much happier when I don't get that message, because sometimes the phone truly doesn't recognize the cable and doesn't charge. I have a couple other Zeetron cables and they are all very reliable like this one.Honestly the design of this keychain fob doesn't really fit my personality. It just doesn't go with my big diesel pickup truck. But I'm also a geek who works for a major technology organization. At work, geeks are cool. So I put a little clip on it (search for "trigger hook" here on Amazon to see what I'm talking about, or see the link in my comment below) and clipped it onto my laptop bag. Now I have a handy-dandy dual use charge cable right at my fingertips whenever I'm at work or travelling.This is a super clever design and incredibly useful. And even if you don't love the hippo motif, just cut it off and still use the handy little cable.I was provided this item for review.

    2014-06-11: ZEETRON selected a clever name for this portable USB charger. Though it is bulky for a key chain, for the contents of this rubber Hippo head the services are compact. It serves as a connector for charging via the USB end for devices using USB and a two headed Lightning USB for iPhone 5S, 5, and iPod devices and a micro USB for Samsung, Nokia, HTC, Blackberry, and LG devices. The only item missing from the kit is a charging source! But of course with all the power banks, wall chargers, and car chargers floating around, everyone has plenty of sources for power - just not enough readily available connectors. This little gadget helps correct that problem. Take it anywhere, charge multiple devices while in the car or on a trip. Works well and is clever to boot. Grady Harp, June 14

    2014-06-11: I wouldn't normally review a non-Apple USB cable immediately after trying it out for the first time, but the problems with this cable occurred immediately. Here's the dealbreaker: this charges extremely slowly. Unacceptably slowly. I first tried it with my iPhone 5 by connecting this cable to my laptop, which is how I almost always charge my phone. Results: In 20 minutes, it charged 2 percentage points. Yes, 2. Also, when I first connected it, I got the "This accessory might not be supported." That's never a good sign, because in my experience, that's a good indication that the cable will completely fail in a month or less.I then tried it with my iPad Air, and the results were even worse. This time, I connected the cable to the iPad Air wall charger (again, this is how I typically charge this device with other cables), and after 12 minutes, it had not charged at all.The lightning connector also has a worryingly tight fit. It takes a bit of force to get the connector into my phone and my iPad, but disconnecting it is even harder. I have to pull quite hard, and I'm genuinely concerned that the force that I have to use could cause the connector to break off in my device.When I look closely at the tip of the lightning connector, I can see some very small scratches and one gouge. Could that be causing the problems? My Apple cable, which I've had for more than six months and use on a daily basis, doesn't have a single visible scratch.This is a shame, because this cable could have been uniquely useful. I was looking forward to having a cable that I could keep stashed in my bag, without worrying that it would get damaged.Note: I received a sample of the product in exchange for an honest review.

    Rating: 2

    2014-06-07: Perhaps I am spoiled, but I recently evaluated a great little Zeetron keychain charger and was hoping this would be a cuter version of the same. It's a great idea, but I'm not totally sold on the execution as I will explain.What you get here is a short USB to both lightning and micro-USB cable (both on one end) that is looped through a keychain. A hollow flexible hippo-head slides down the cable to cover up the cable ends. By pushing the cable through, you can easily plug it into a USB port or a charger and charge up your Apple product with lightning cable input (iPhone, iPad, etc) or a device with a Micro-USB input. For those of us who have a bluetooth headset with Micro-USB, it is nice to have both on 1 cable. The cable itself seems high quality and sturdy with enough flex to make it easy to reach between devices.The problem I had is that the lightning cable is not extended off of the plastic block at all - it is flush with the block. That means if you have any sort of case on your phone at all, even a thin one, the cable won't work (my phone is in an Amazon Basics case). Zeetron addressed this already with theirZeetron Ultra Compact Emergency Keychain Usb Cable - Black Lighting to USB (For Iphone 5, 5c, 5s, Ipad 4, Air, Mini, Ipod Touch 5th Gen)by having the lightning cable on a small extension block. This extension was good enough to get past the thin case on my iPhone. Unfortunately, this design feature didn't make it onto the hippo.So ultimately, it's a really really cute keychain and a great idea, but I can't carry it because the lightning connector won't mate with my iPhone while in the case. If you carry a naked iPhone, then this is a great way to always have a cable by your side.Note: I received a free sample from the manufacturer for the purposes of review.

    2014-06-19: It's hard to find the sweet spot between USB-mini USB cords which are three feet long and ones that while shorter can be lost easily. This attempts to bridge that gap. The Zeetron Cute Hippo 2 in 1 USB cable, as it says, is cute and it's rubber. You reach in the beastie's mouth, pull gently on its tongue and you get the plugs to pluck out.While this is not a toy and I suspect a child or impatient adult might yank the cord from the wire and rip the rubber ring, with care, this offers a few inches so you can use the Micro and main USB or iPhone-compatible plug to charge or connect.It is a bit of a tight fit, as there's not much room to maneuver and devices need to be in very close proximity. Of course, this is the limit of a pair of cords that can be stuffed back in the hippo's maw. But, if this is possible, and no tension on cord or jack remains, this can work to solve the problem of a cable and a portable version that, on a key ring or carabiner, can not be misplaced as easily as a random cord. A clever invention.
