    2014-04-08: I bought this so I could connect my Bluetooth enabled phone, to my non-Bluetooth enabled car.It works great and the sound quality is better than I expected considering it is using a standard 3.5 mm jack input. We have had Sirius XM radio for years going thorough that exact same port. The quality of the audio was ok at best. Due to the fact that Sirius plays the same songs over and over and the comedy channels we liked are full of ads, we discontinued it and decided to use our phones.I was expecting the quality to be very similar since I was using the same jack. It was not. This works great. If you have your speaker set too high though and your bluetooth audio is not set at full, you will hear some hiss in the background. So if you have any issues, check the output of your device first.The one thing it does not do, that I was hoping, is automatically connect when I start up the car. I have it always plugged in via the micro usb cable provided and was hoping that when I turn on the engine, this would turn on and therefore connect to my phone. It does not. I have to hold the power button till it turns on and connects each time. Perhaps when the battery on it deteriorates, it will always turn on when the power turns on from the engine and then it will work that way. That is what kept this from getting 5 stars.

    2014-06-05: Bought this because I was tired of having my phone plugged into the car via the aux in 3.5mm cable, and also possibly the charger. I just moved to the NY-Long Island area from western PA, and I sometimes have long drives back and forth. In addition, this lets me make/take calls virtually hands free. I say virtually because you still have to hit some buttons to use the voice activation as you normally do with most phones/headsets/etc. I haven't any issues with someone not hearing me as of yet, but I normally put up the windows so I can hear better. Also did notice as others had said that I needed to turn the radio up a bit to hear the person I had on the phone, however they don't seem to have a problem hearing me. Overall, I bought this more for the ease of streaming music, and so far it has done that job very well. Another great feature this device has that I haven't seen on many devices is that with an iphone, it will display the mPow's battery level. This is a great feature that I've only heard about bluetooth headsets having.Update: I wish I could find the other reviews on this as well, but I discovered the device apparently has separate volumes for music and calls. I was turning my radio way up to hear people on calls and then getting blasted when hanging up and returning to music. If you use the volume buttons on the device while on a call, you can adjust it up instead of using the car stereo volume. This enabled me to max both out on the device and just use the car manual volume to adjust accordingly and both were much closer and not getting blasted after hanging up.

    2014-07-08: It worked well for a month, then crapped out. Rather disappointed, but it was cheap.Two stars because it worked.

    Rating: 2

    2014-06-26: Purchased this for my son, who likes to have his music everywhere with him. This works great with his nice headset! He plugs the headset into this and bluetooths his music to his headphones - it's like having a wireless headset! Excellent product!

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-07: Having bought and tried several other brands of plug-in car Bluetooth receivers that all were worthless, I was less than hopeful about ordering this one. I was in for a surprise!Plugged into the AUX port on my '07 Honda Civic, once paired with my IPhone and the radio turned to AUX, it actually works! When the phone signals an incoming call while I am playing music, the music stops and, through one of the smarter features in a smart phone, the phone function takes over. The receiver then resumes streaming the music from the phone to the speakers a few seconds after the phone call ends.To be clear: These are retrofit devices. Most new cars do not need them because the Bluetooth function is built-in. For those of us driving cars old enough to not have that feature and just new enough to come equipped with an AUX plug port - this little device is perfect. It takes about an hour to charge and will play for nearly 5 hours between recharges. I recharge mine via a USB cable while driving!For under $20. this is a VERY nicely made retrofit device.Being an imperfect world with imperfect people and devices, I would be remiss in not mentioning that as a phone microphone, it is useless. No one will hear you - But, as a Bluetooth music player, it is wonderfully good at this price point.

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-27: Cheap, and it works, plug is removable and will accept any standard 3.5mm stereo audio cable.Bluetooth phone calls in my car are not the best, but my car is really noisy so that's probably not it's fault.Sound quality for podcasts and music is great.

    2014-06-03: This meets my expectations. works well with cars and any appliance with auxiliarr output. I would recommend this to my friends.

    Rating: 4

    2013-07-23: For bluetooth technology and a couple other bells and whistles, my dealership was asking $1500 for the "technology" package for my 2012 car. Anyways, i refused to pay 1500 bucks just to wirelessly stream music to my car and decided to buy this bluetooth adapter for 20 bucks. It works flawlessly, connects to my phone in a couple seconds and has an incredibly long battery life!The sound quality is just fine and i have no trouble with distortion or anything like that. I'm no audiophile so i cant judge the small tiny details, but for an average person looking to wireless stream music to their car/stereo/etc. this works flawlessly!Money well spent:)

    Rating: 5

    2013-04-19: For $20, this EDUP streaming music device does a pretty good job. I'm using this to stream music from my iphone 5 to my car's stereo. My car has a 3.5mm auxilliary jack and I currently use a long cord to connect the phone to the stereo. It's cumbersome and the wire always gets in the way.Here's what the EDUP does well: (1) Easy to pair with my iphone 5 (just push the button for about 7 seconds until the lights flash and it's done). (2) Easy to turn on (just hold the button for about 3 seconds until the light flashes and the audio indicator plays over the car's speakers to let you know it's on). (3) Easy to turn off (just push the button for about 5 seconds until the light flashes and the audio tone tells you it's off). (4) Sounds just as good as plugging my phone directly into the auxilliary audio port in my car. (5) Can play and charge at the same time via the 12V power outlet in my car -- I leave it plugged in all the time. (6) Falls asleep to conserve power when not used for about 20 minutes. (7) When a call comes in, I am able to turn on my bluetooth earpiece and the audio switches from the EDUP to my earpiece appropriately. (8) Comes with a short male 3.5mm to male 3.5mm jack (shown in the picture), a male 3.5mm to male 3.5 cable in case the little jack won't physically fit in your car (I prefer the cable because the auxilliary port is in the bottom of the center console of my car, which is tough to reach with all my junk in there -- the cable allows me to put the EDUP on top of the stuff in the center console which is easier to reach), and a short micro USB charging cable.Here's what could be improved: (1) While the on/off function isn't horrible, it could be easier... maybe toggle between on/off without having to count 3 or 5 seconds depending on which operation you want (seems like the device could figure out that if "I'm currently on and the user is pressing the button, the user wants to me to turn off now")... maybe separate buttons... maybe move the light indicator so it isn't directly on the button (which ends up being under the finger that is pressing the buttons). (2) I'd love it if this would automatically wake up when I turn on the car... maybe it could recognize that power from the 12V outlet is off and go to sleep and then when the power is restored, it could wake up. I realize the EDUP also runs on battery power, so this may not be technically feasible given that it will "always" have some form of power. (3) When I hang-up the bluetooth earpiece after taking a call, it would be awesome if the EDUP would resume playing music. As it is now, the music pauses when I switch over to the earpiece and I have to actually press the "play" button on the phone to get the music to resume after I hang up the earpiece. I think this is probably a function of the phone, not the EDUP, though.If the EDUP could do #1 on the things on the "to be improved" list, I would have given it 5 stars. If it could everything on my "to be improved" list, I would have given it 5 stars AND I would have been willing to pay an additional $10 or $20 for the device. Other than that, it's a great little device and does what I had hoped it would do.UPDATED: I started to get really irritated with the "hold the button for 3 seconds to turn on and 5 seconds to turn off" functionality. It seems that I could never get the hang of what 3/5 seconds felt like and it constantly took me 2 or 3 tries to get this thing to turn on/off. I purchased a different bluetooth receiver that doesn't have a battery. With the new receiver, when there's power, it's on. When there's no power, it's off. No on/off switch to deal with. I like it much better for my particular application.

    Rating: 4

    2014-03-01: Either I am incompetent or this thing doesn't want to pair with my headphone by, Syba. Amazon SKU of B008NIMCS4, or my old Sony headphone, DR-BT101. I have a B004J2TPSI, Kokkia transmitter that pair with these headphones. I turn on the transmitter until the light is blinking, then press the pair button on the headphone until the light stops blinking. Then I know its been paired and ready to go. No luck with the Mpowe for me. Hope you have better luck than I did. So I will have to order another same, Kokkia even if it costs more.

    2014-04-27: I originally bought the Belkin F8Z492TTP Bluetooth Music Receiver. What a waste of money, the sound on that thing was tinny and just horrible.This unit is absolutely perfect. I have a Monster Cable iCarPlay Cassette Adapter with a Mini Jack connector that I used to plug into my Kindle or my Phone to play music in the car. The Silver Mini Adapter you see coming out of the Mpow unit is actually removable, so the Mini Jack can plug directly into the Mpow Unit. Additionally, the Micro USB adapter plugs into my Auto USB, charging the unit while it's in use. Best of all, unlike some other units I've seen advertised on Amazon, there's ZERO interference if you're charging while using the unit.04/29/2014 - Update:I attached my Asus TF101 to my passenger side visor to run Music and Videos (Synced off Plex). I forgot that my phone was also connected via bluetooth, but I was pretty surprised when I was listening to some music and the music paused because a call was coming in on my Note 2.     Rating: 5

    2013-07-08: Bought this item so I could use my phone wireless in my vehicle that only has auxiliary input. As others have mentioned you do have to read the directions a few times regarding how long to press the button to pair a device or power on and off, but the instructions are clear. Also, the device gives feedback by red or blue leds under the button, which you can't really see if you are pressing the button. As far as once connected the device works perfectly fine and I have yet to really have any issues using for about 10 hours. I set this up in my vehicle to be a permanent type of installation which is always plugged into the aux and a charger so I don't have to keep charging it. Only issue though is I ran into a lot of ground loop noise, which is pretty common with this type of device and can be fixed with a ground loop isolator, which I already had installed anyways.On another note, the packaging was nice and also came with a short usb cord and also a long auxillary cable which is actually thicker and better quality than some of the cheaper cables that can come bundled with these accessories.

    Rating: 4

    2014-06-11: Synced simply with my iPhone 5s and plugged it into my car's audio port for wireless aux music/calling. Music works awesome, have not tried a call yet. No onboard mic on this product so I'll have to use the phone's mic. Item comes with the male to male adapter (shown as the silver piece in the pics) and also with a male to make adapter cable if you don't want a rigid connector. Additionally comes with a full sized male USB to micro USB cable for charging. DOES NOT come with a wall outlet adapter for charging (but used my iphone wall adapter and it worked well). Used it today for two 45 minute commutes (1.5 hours total) with no charging between and it worked great. Planning to get a USB lighter adapter to keep it plugged in full time in the car. Overall unit is approx. 1.5 inches long, 1 inch wide and 1/2 inch thick (not including the removeable male to male adapter shown in the pictures. Highly recommend for wireless use in the car. Would buy again!

    2014-06-26: This is a great adapter for the price. It fits my needs exactly. It's pretty small, a lot smaller than I thought it'd be, but this makes it perfect for tossing in my purse or pocket. For the most part, though, it spends most its time in my car. Because this thing only has three buttons (power, volume up and down) it's pretty self explanatory, but you should keep the little leaflet of instructions just in case. Pairing it was easy and it transmitted music from my phone to my car's speakers just as I hoped it would. A little tip; the volume buttons don't act as such for me when using them with my phone (Moto X). Instead of changing the volume, it skips or goes back tracks in Google Music, which is actually pretty great for me as I can easily use the volume buttons on my steering wheel instead and would prefer hard buttons to change music tracks than relying on looking at phone while driving. Another great thing about this transmitter, that, while not exactly the prettiest one on offer, it charges up quickly, stays charged for a good while, and doesn't need to constantly plugged in to external power to run. This adapter is great for use in cars and because of its size it stays completely out of the way until you need it.

The device is simple, but does what I need it to and does it without complication. If this one lasts, I will chalk it up to bad luck and probably come back and up my rating even further. Just the customer service brings it from 1 star to 3. Hopefully more on the way.

    Rating: 3

    2013-12-11: I am neither impressed nor disappointed with this product. It arrived quickly and was easy to set up just as described. All I had to do pretty much was plug it in, turn it on, and then pair my HTC One SV. So far, so good. I am not bothered in the least by having to hold the button for 3 seconds in order to turn it on. Music sounds just as good as wired connection in my car, without noticeable interference. Battery life is respectable and it notifies me with a beeping noise before it dies to remind me to plug it in. Turns itself off automatically sometime after I leave my car but before the battery dies. Some people are saying about 20 minutes and I believe them. These are the good points of this device.My experience deviated somewhat on other points that weren't quite working for me as described. First, everytime I turn it on now, I have to go into my phone and tell it to connect. This is extremely frustrating and could possibly be related to my HTC One as much as it is this device. In my experience with bluetooth devices (Some of my work involves setting up and fixing devices that connect wirelessly), certain equipment just seems to work better than others when mated together. Sometimes one has to search to find the combination that works best. This is compounded by my bluetooth headset (Samsung HM7000) that also now doesn't want to connect by itself until it is the only device around. My phone routinely drops either this device or the headset, without notifying me, and they fight for the media audio and phone audio outputs. This never ocurred prior to the addition of the Mpow, despite concurrently having three different model bluetooth headsets. This would be somewhat easier to live with if I used the Mpow exclusively for phone conversation within the car but I have received numerous complaints about poor sound quality by the people that I am talking to. I can hear them through the car speakers but they have a hard time hearing me through the Mpow's microphone. Turning off all the fans and rolling up the windows helps but does not eliminate the problem. One touch calling or answering is dicey in my experience and works about half the time. This is not a big issue for me as it is easier to just press the voice call or answer button on my phone screen, than it is to press the button on this device. I include that simply to illustrate my contention that the description by the seller is a bit optimistic, in my opinion, as to the ease of use for phone calls. These are snags that aren't really deal-breakers for me but definitely detract from my overall user experience.To sum it up, as a wireless music receiver this thing is great and I would recommend it highly. As a hands-free device to make and receive phone calls without having to dial a number or look at the phone, this device is a nightmare and possibly deserves negative stars for the potential hazards of trying to reconnect the bluetooth stereo receiver at 65 mph in traffic on the freeway after the signal drops. As a result, I gave it a three overall. This is not, as I stated, entirely the fault of this device as my phone plays just as big of a part. They just don't seem to "like" each other, which translates to a headache for me. i am still shopping and eagerly await for the day that I can just get into my car, place my phone on the dock, put on a wireless earpiece, and have both the earpiece for the phone, and stereo for the music, connect without any intervention. If anyone is having that particular experience with their HTC, please let me know what products are working for you. Thanks for reading.

    2014-04-10: This review is from: EasyAcc Samsung Galaxy Note 3 Case Cover Leather Flip with Stand For N9000 N9005 Samsung galaxy note 3 3G & LTE smartphone phone Accessories(PU Leather, Black) (Wireless Phone Accessory)I like this bi-case leather material - it's split leather (fibrous leather) with polyurethane. The material is smooth and easy to clean. The stand is actually quite nice and practical, and I don't usually use the iPad stands with which I'd become familiar. Product provided by EasyAcc.

    Rating: 5

    2014-02-04: This is a great case to protect your Note 3, and can't be beat for the price.The design is well planned and thought out. There are four clips that hold the phone firmly in place. On the left side, the clips are on the corners. On the right side, the clips are on the side. There is plenty of room to access the power button, charging port, and the "S Pen".The exterior is "Synthetic PU Leather", which feels like soft glove leather. Some people might prefer genuine leather, but you can't even tell the difference. The interior is microfiber, which fell like suede. The softness of the microfiber will protect the back and screen.Once your phone is placed inside the case, it is safely protected by the cover, which clips to the right side of the phone. On the back, the camera and flash cut out is just the right size. The case can also be used in landscape mode to view movies. This is done by adding a groove into the cover, which holds the phone at the perfect viewing angle.CONTENTS:EassyAcc Samsung Note 3 Leather Flip CaseFEATURES:Exterior: Synthetic PU LeatherInterior: MicrofiberI was supplied a sample for the purpose of review.

    Rating: 5

    2014-02-06: This is a simple yet elegant case for the Galaxy Note 3. It's made of a synthetic PU leather that's very classy looking. The phone is clipped in with 4 corner clips. The front is thickly padded, the inside is a gray microfiber material. The single opening fits well. It converts quickly into a stand with a single motion (see photos). Overall, a nice and inexpensive case. Sample was provided for review purposes.

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-29: I received a review sample and carefully examined this case before swapping my Note 3 into it. The fit is perfect. This case definitely holds the Note 3 firmly in place using two diagonally placed tabs to hold the left side of the phone and two that that are lined up on the right side.What makes the design so clever is the minimalist design that has maximum function. This is evidenced by the 'catch' on the outer cover flap also functions as the catch for using this case as a stand as well as a magnetic-free clasp for closing the cover. The clever design is also shown by the arrangement of the tabs that I mentioned above. The four tabs are placed in a manner as to not interfere with any button or function. It does not block the camera or flash, and you can use any size charging cable without the case interfering. That last feature is important because I own one heavy-duty USB 3.0 cable that is a tight fit when my phone is in other cases that I have tried.This case is also heavily padded. It looks beautiful, but thanks to the thinner PU synthetic leather the case is constructed with a heavy foam padding under the PU exterior that truly protects the phone. There is even a channel designed into the outer cover that strengthens that part, which provides another level or protection.The tabs and catch I mentioned are also made of the padded synthetic leather, which absorbs the shock from a fall a lit better than the harder plastic that other cases use.At the time of this review this case cost less than ten bucks, but is designed and made better than a few more expensive cases that I own for my Note 3. For function and price this is the best one I own and one that I have no problem recommending to friends.

    Rating: 5

    2014-03-20: This case fits my Galaxy Note 3 snugly, and with one quick motion converts into a stand that is the perfect position to view videos.The faux-leather feels good to the touch and the material inside is soft to the touch, like a microfiber cloth. Not sure how well it would protect the phone to a drop on the corner or edge, but the padding on the front and back are more than enough to protect the device when landing screen-or-back-down. The cutout on the back of the phone is large enough to not impede pictures while the case is one the phone.I am happy with this case, and I love how easy it is to stand up on a flat surface for hands free viewing of videos.The manufacturer sent me a review unit in exchange for a fair and honest review.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-19: This works great. I have an S4 with the wireless charger battery door plus I have a case on it. After removing the insert the phone did fit perfectly. A pleasant surprise!     Rating: 5

    2014-03-23: This charger was a pleasant surprise. I expected it to work and the phone to fit but that was about it. Keep in mind I tossed the charger and USB cable that came with this charger in a drawer. I'm using the (Amazon Kindle Fire 5ft USB to Micro-USB Cable) connected to a (Samsung OEM 2.0 Amp Travel Charger). Here are my Pros and Cons....Pros:1. The plastic has a nice soft silky feel to it. The base is the perfect weight and size that I feel comfortable it won't fall over.2. The battery compartment fit is right on using the OEM Samsung battery as well as a RAVPower spare I had on hand. The fit, with or without an insert (I'm using a Samsung Protective Bumper Cover Plus Case for Galaxy S4), is close while still leaving a little wiggle room.3. Rubber feet/tabs do a good job of keeping the base from moving on a slippery nightstand.Cons:1. Worst is the blue light on the front. This is a very common problem with electronics these days. Companies don't stop to think whether a power light is necessary on their products. I would say a large number of these products are on their owners nightstands. Why would we want a light shining in our eyes while we're trying to sleep? If this light had a reason to be on the charger this might forgive it but it lights blue when plugged into a power source. That's its entire function. It doesn't change color when your phone is charging or when it completes it's charge. Why can't it flash three times when plugged in then go out? Or be smaller and located on the back of the unit? I ended up covering this up with some folded paper and masking tape.2. Second issue is minor and not really fair but I'll mention it anyway. I wish this had an audio out. I'm not rating this lower for this but I'll list it as a con because this unit should include this feature. Even if they charge $2 or $3 extra bucks this would have put this charger at a solid 5 star rating. Feel free to disagree with me on this one.Conclusion: Overall I'm very happy with this charger, despite my long rant about the power light! lol. I would have knocked off 1/2 star for the the power light but being as it's an easy fix and 4 1/2 stars isn't allowed I rounded up. No matter how I looked at it, it was definitely worth the $19.99 I paid. I've been using this for 10 days now. If I experience any problems I will update this review.

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-15: I have used this cradle and charger for a while. I do not like to write a review until I have tested the product longer. When I received the product, I was amazed on how well the product was constructed. The cradle was made with quality plastic that was quite thick, strong, and heavy. It felt very sturdy. The product had good fitting for both the cradle and the spare battery charger in the back. I will write about both functionality. Also I was surprised that this product came with a USB cord and the plug for an outlet. In the past when I bought some cradle chargers, some company do not give you the extra cable and charger, and expect you to use the one that came with your phone. This way you have a spare to use.The Samsung S4 fit perfectly in the cradle, there was no gap and the phone laid perfectly in the slot. The charging capability of the charger was as good as the original charger. The only issue I have is that I have a hard back case which is not as easy to remove to charge. As this cradle is perfect fit for s S4 with no protective cover. If you have no cover or an easy to remove soft cover then this would work well for you.As for the rear spare battery charger, that was good. I have an extra spare battery that I use the charger to charge and be ready at all times. The battery fit perfectly. It is an actual slot that the battery fit perfectly in. It is unlike other battery chargers where the pins are flimsy. The charging pins are not exposed, so as long as you push the battery in, it is in place. The only issue some might have, is that this charger is quite slow, it is more of a trickle charge, so do not expect it to charge as fast as the cradle portion. I am ok with that, as I have always heard that slow charging is better for the battery. Overall this product is great and I would trust the products of this company.

    Rating: 5

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-05: My schedule is hectic. Almost every day I attend college from 8AM to 3:30PM, and right after I work from 4PM to 12PM. Both school and work involves me using my phone. Whether it's contacting clients or researching information for classroom discussions, let's just say my Galaxy S4 is always under heavy usage. Even though the S4 has a much improved battery life than the previous models, it is still no where near perfect to run an entire day on one charge. I was lucky enough to be contacted by RAVPower to try this product. When I realized this product would enable me to charge my device and a spare batery, I was very excited because this would solve my battery issues for long days. Due to my previous positive experiences with their products, I decided to try this one out without any hesitation.Within two days the product was at my doorstep. The charging dock came packaged very nicely in a box. Once I took the product out of the box, I was very impressed by the overall build and quality. For the price point, the design and attention to detail really caught my attention. The front part of the docking system has a beautiful glossy finish to match your S4's body, whereas the sides of the product has a matte finish, complementing the S4's brushed steel look. The back of the charging system has a little insert to charge a spare battery. Now, it has a little LED light to show if the battery is charging. When the LED light is glowing red, it indicates that the battery is charging. Once the charging is complete, the LED light switches from RED to GREEN. The charging time for the docking system is extremely fast, within about an hour I can charge my phone completely. The charging time for the spare battery isn't as fast, it takes about 1 hour and 40ish minutes to charge the battery completely, which isn't bad at all.For the price point, RAVpower is enabling customers of Amazon to get a gorgeous charging dock for a very low price. The quality and performance of the product does not make sense for the price point. If you are someone such as me with a busy schedule or if you are just someone who likes to put their phone under heavy usage, this is a great product for you because it will always enable you to have a spare fully charged battery, no matter where you are.RAVPower has an amazing customer service team. I've never had any problems with their products but they have always taken their time to respond to any questions I have ever had in order to make sure that I was fully content. I highly recommend this product, not only for it's performance and quality but also for the company that is behind it!

    2011-06-28: It fits my Thunderbolt with the 2,750 battery perfectly.I also frequently drop my phone and the battery and cover go flying. This should prevent that from happening and should extend the life of my TB dramatically.However, I just realized that they also make a 1 piece cover called SURFACE (it does not seem to be listed on amazon).This cover is two separate pieces. A silicone inner cover (the "skin") and a harder shell with 6 arms (the "skeleton") that wrap around the inner cover at the corners and two at the sides. There is a kickstand in the skeleton that you used instead of the kickstand built into the TB.The very nice thing about this kickstand, is that it can support the phone from either side, which enables charging while you are watching a movie... very cool.I do not really notice much of a decrease in sound coming from the speaker phone (as others have mentioned). I'd rather have the 2 way kickstand than that extra 2 decibels. I seldom use that speaker anyway.Note that Seidio is currently selling a desktop stand/charger that allows you to not remove this case and charge it while it is one its side (see comments)I have also cut out the volume controls so that I am no longer accidentally changing the volume every time I touch the phone.

    2011-11-21: As others have said there are limited choices for the Thunderbolt with the extended battery. Since HTC only includes a wimpy little battery that only lasts a few hours I don't see how you can't buy an extended battery to get through the day. Initially I thought I could get away without it as things would balance out and battery life would improve and was using the regular battery with the Body Glove case which was perfect. Alas, the included battery never got any better so I bought the extended one and unfortunately the Body Glove case wouldn't fit the phone with the extended battery and I can't find a Body Glove case to replace it so began the hunt for a new case. This Seidio seemed to be the best option which arrived today and I already can't stand it especially compared to the Body Glove case. To point out the positives, it does install easily, fits the phone well, and seems like it will add a nice level of protection for the phone. I also like the side grips quite a bit. The Seidio does not feel the least bit slippery to me which is of course a good thing. What I really dislike about the Seidio is that you can't use the sturdy included kickstand and the kickstand with the Seidio case is just an incredibly flimsy piece of plastic that feels like it may break at any time. The kickstand is also an extremely tight fit into the case nearly needing a pry bar to open it and its equally difficult to close. Every time I close it the kickstand feels like its about to break off and it very well may very soon but I shouldn't have to worry about that each time I use it. The kickstand also makes a very loud clicking sound when you close it. That's not good when you need to be stealthy in a meeting, at the movies, etc. It also has a chemical smell to the case which transfers to your hands. I hope this smell fades over time and that its not toxic but for now I'm washing my hands more than ever thanks to this case. I suppose for now this is really the only choice unfortunately if you use the extended battery but I really look forward to the day when I can ditch it for a Body Glove case. There is also no belt clip but in fairness I knew that before I bought it. This isn't exactly a pocketable phone so get used to carrying it all of the time.

    2014-01-11: This is my second Trident case. I've dropped my phone several times and the phone survived perfectly.     Rating: 5

    2013-10-02: For one, the kickstand is SO hard to open, I can't even use the kickstand, and that's one of the reasons I purchased a Trident case, so I could have the kickstand capability.The phone case is VERY SLIPPERY. The Galaxy S4 case (which my significant other purchased at the same time) is rubberized on the sides so it's easy to hold onto. As far as the Galaxy S3 case - I've almost dropped my GS3 phone IN the Kraken case a few times already, and I've only had it a few hours. His kickstand isn't as hard to open as mine and he even has a hard time opening mine; it's as if the case is going to break in order to get the kickstand in the open position for the GS3 case. BEWARE!I don't understand why there isn't rubberized grips on the GS3 hard case like there is on the GS4 hard case, and the GS3 case makes you PUT ON the screen protector, whereas the GS4 case already has it built in. I'm very disappointed in this GS3 case and will be returning it. It's claimed on the Trident website that it's such a great case, but in actuality, I have more of a "drop risk" using this case than I do a little cheap rubberized case!! This Trident Kraken GS3 case is huge hazard to my phone!I would recommend NOT to purchase this phone case.

    Rating: 1

    2013-01-05: This is my first actual "Rugged" type of phone case. I'm more used to tpu's and thin shell type cases but ever since my first galaxy s3 broke from a drop with the Ringke Slim case I decided I should play it safe and get a rugged case for my replacement.Just got the case today so I'm not sure how the protection is but it definitely looks like its well protected. The thickness isn't as bad as I thought it would be but I have bigger hands so others might think its a little too big.The silicon Perseus case fits it well. It can be used by itself if you don't want the full bulk of the case but I don't think I would use it by itself much. The power/volume buttons are hard to hit with just the silicon skin because the skin is nice and thick to make it hard to reach.The outer polycarbonate shell fits around the silicon very nicely and snuggly. I don't like built in screen protectors because they tend to interfere and this one doesn't come with a built in. It does come with an included free one but it's not too great. The port plugs fit awesomely. It is true that the top speaker cutout isn't centered but it doesn't effect call quality and you can't really see because there's a mesh covering the opening. It probably wouldn't have fit if they moved it over to the right more that might be why.The belt clip I think is great! It's small and doesn't look ridiculous on your hip. Other reviews seem to hate the clip because it's so small and hard to work but honestly its so easy to get it clipped on even without looking. It just slides right into the grooves by itself. The only hard part I can understand is getting it out but there's a way to get it out one handed if you just put your index finger sideways in between the clip and phone and leverage the phone out it comes out easily! You just have to try it a few times.So far this case is great! Oh and I chose this case over otterbox defender because I like the hard outershell instead of silicon outershell. Shipping was also fantastic. Got it in 2 days from the free super savers 5-7 day option! Probably because I was so close to their smartpost.

    Rating: 5

    2014-05-15: I really love these brand of cases....Trident makes great covers and they last...They also look really nice and are very durable...I definitely would buy them off amazon any time

    Rating: 5

    2012-12-24: There are loads of cheap and poorly made car chargers for Apple devices on the market. I was a bit skeptical about these, but am pleasantly surprised at how well they've held up. Only time will tell in the long run on the durability factor. The portion that plugs into your car is a nice size and easy to insert and remove...as it the end of the charger that goes into your device. My only complaint is the packaging and shipping. The items were shipped individually in thin white boxes (all contained in a large yellow envelope) and arrived looking as if a hippo had taken a long nap on them. Fortunately, the chargers didn't appear damaged in shipping and function well. I can only give this item three stars since I have yet to find out if they'll still work properly in a year or to...and the packaging for shipping was very disappointing. Otherwise, if you're looking for an inexpensive charger (these would make a great backup charger...never hurts to have a spare!) this item will do quite well.

  • B00AZZOH04

    $B00AZZOH04

    A great description that explains what this product is all about. Here's what you get!

    2014-01-17: Does just as it is advertised. The battery lasts a lonnnnnggg time but it also makes the phone very big and heavy (as expected). I really didn't mind the huge and heavy size but some people definitely will. Take this into consideration before you buy it.

    Rating: 5

    2013-07-16: *Disclosure: I was contacted by ZeroLemon and given a sample of this product specifically for the purpose of reviewing it.*As smartphones get smarter, bigger, and thinner, battery technology has a hard time keeping up. With my Galaxy Nexus, I needed to charge three times a day or more with the stock battery. Overnight, mid morning, again in the afternoon, and perhaps yet again in the evening so that I had enough power left to finish out the day. On really slow days, I was looking at just charging over night and again at midday. After popping in the ZeroLemon extended battery, all that changed. Once fully charged up, heavy days only dropped the battery to ~40% and average days to ~60%, So now, I might need a charge every day and a half at most. Given that this battery has several times the capacity as the stock one, this information shouldn't be too surprising.The offset to all the run time is of course the added size and weight that has been added to my Nexus. Roughly, it's a little more than double thick now with the case on. And, you're going to have to use the included case, as no one else that I'm aware of makes a case to fit this monster in. It's not bad though, allowing free access to all the ports and buttons, not to mention fits well. If you use NFC, have no fear with this battery/case combo. It works just fine. And finally, it could be just me, but I've found that the added size helps a bit with texting, as in, it's easier to type. It does take some getting used to in terms of the size and weight though.All in all, love it so far and still have 160 days to see if I can break it.

    Rating: 5

    2013-09-06: I dont know what i do wrong with my batteries. But i have been through 1 normal battery. 2 extended batteries (hyperion) and this guy. This guy is just amazing. The case is the best case ive ever seen with an extended battery. it just feels good to hold. and sturdy. no more of that backplate bull they pull with all other batteries. This thing finally allowed me to use my galaxy nexus well past 24 hours. The warranty is top notch just like the product quality. if you have a galaxy nexus phone. this is the absolute only way to go when purchasing a new battery. Dont hesitate. Dont question. Your search ends here.

    Rating: 5

    2013-04-29: I clearly must have gotten a defective model, because there's no way the other 2 reviewers didn't even attempt to make a phone call or use voice commands when this battery/case combo was installed. Both microphones are completely blocked and the device is unusable as a phone without modifying the case, which is easier said than done.The battery part works as advertised, but since it requires the case to stay in the device and the case prevents the device from being used as a phone, I can't rate it highly. Adds a lot of weight and bulk but that's to be expected.

    Rating: 3

    2013-07-25: Several weeks ago the folks that make the[ZeroLemon Samsung Galaxy Nexus 5900mAh Extended Battery )sent me one of these to test. Here in Vermont it can be a long way to get help if you break down and pay phones are few and very far between, so it is important that the cell phone is always charged. I keep a cell phone around of course, but I don't use it a lot (mine is always dead when I need it), so after I examined the product, checked the fit and read all the paperwork, I twisted my son-in-law's arm to do the actual testing for me, since he is a Wireless Expert for one of the big phone companies and virtually lives on his phone, which always seems to need charging.First, a bit of a description - The battery pack replaces the one in your phone and comes with an replacement phone back. After installation (takes less than a minute) your phone will be about twice as thick as it was* and weigh close to twice as much. The battery comes with a 180 day guarantee. Let me give you the reports directly from my SIL -SIL - So just a status update with the battery. I am very happy with it. I unplugged it at 7:30 yesterday morning (I received this at 11 am) and as of right now I have 12% battery life. One downfall is the bulkiness of the phone* now, but I don't mind that considering the battery life.GRANDMA - That's excellent. Your wife said you have been playing on it quite a bit. Do you have any estimate of the number of hours you've used by any chance? And will it still fit in your pocket?SIL - Phone use has been 21 hours 38 minutes and 23 seconds. Cell turned on 1 day 2 hrs 50 minutes and 27 seconds. And yes it still fits in my pockets but someone with tight pockets may have a problem. I have not tried with jeans yet that have tighter pockets. (He took the phone camping in his jeans - no problem at all.)SIL - My battery just died. I got so much out of one charge. Having it charge right now, will tell you how long it takes to charge, but from 7:30 yesterday morning till 4:30pm is excellent and best battery life that I have ever had!SIL - To fully charge it takes four hours but that is with me using it while charging it. If I don't use it, about three hours.Several weeks later, the battery is still going strong and I haven't seen my SIL's phone plugged into the car charger once. (He tells me he puts it on the charger every other night when he goes to bed.) I suspect I'll get that battery back only if I pry the cell phone from his cold dead hands.Grandma's $0.02 - AWESOME battery life! Two thumbs up!

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-21: Just not enough juice for the extra girth. I've used this on trips, and I've gotten better results from products that are lighter.

    Rating: 3

    2013-11-20: Awesome.I bought a Seidio 3800 battery over a year and a half ago and it was in need of being replaced. My original 2100 battery (this is the ORIGINAL Verizon version of the Galaxy Nexus from 2011,) only lasted about 8 hours. So I bought a Trexell 3800 that wasn't much better. I then bought the Seidio 3800 and my phone was lasting 20-36 hours depending on use. This past month or so, it was not lasting more than 8 hours or so.I had intended on buying another Seidio, but I originally paid about $40 and now they want $60. No way. This ZeroLemon was about $40 so I thought I would give it a try.SOO GLAD I DID. Yes it makes the phone thicker, but I don't mind that. I have only completely discharged it three times so far (you are supposed to do it 6 times) and I have had to keep it off the charger for up to three nights and it finally drains late into the next day.BIG BONUS: The clip for the Siedio fits this case. The Siedio surface case was almost necessary to keep the battery back on the phone or the back would fall off and the battery would fall out. I was buying a new surface case for the Seidio every 4-6 months. The clip could be bought separately.The case for this battery is MUCH better. It actually adds a bit of protection for the phone.

    Rating: 5

    2013-09-09: A surprisingly good fit, that gives my Galaxy Nexus new-found endurance.I really like my Galaxy Nexus and use it heavily, but between steady usage and sometimes poor Sprint coverage, I was charging or topping-off the factory-original battery 1-2, even 3 times a day, and it was making my phone much less useful-- running low or dying outright (usually at inconvenient times).I didn't expect much of this third-party battery, and figured it would be an awkward fit, but it turns out to fit the Nexus very snugly and precisely-- it would be a struggle to get the replacement cover off the phone now (it was pretty easy to get into place). The new back is rubbery instead of plasticy like the original. It doesn't look elegant, but it works fine, and after two months of constant use hasn't show any signs of wear.And the battery life... Oh the battery life! I got 3 days, 4 hours on battery the very first time I had this ZeroLemon installed-- and it wasn't even completely drained at the end of that. Typically I charge the battery every 2 days now, just to keep a full charge. Quite the improvement!Do follow the vendor's recommended charging procedures, but even without doing it rigorously, the results are excellent (my first-time results were from charging a few hours less than recommended). So charging directions are very particular, and are certainly going to give optimal results, but don't sweat it if you don't follow them exactly.Also, the ZeroLemon does still support NFC, so you don't lose that function by going with an aftermarket battery. It really Just Works, which is a great thing (and sometimes unusual in the aftermarket product sector).As far as caveats and concerns: The side buttons take a slightly firmer press now (through the rubber shell), but still work fine. The speakerphone (which I rarely use) is a bit muffled by being recessed more deeply than before. If charging while powered off, the battery symbol shows full soon enough, but you shouldn't detach it yet (booted up, you'll see it's still charging). Since the battery capacity now shows red/critically low for many hours (up to a day in my use) before failing, you may also find Android stops polling for updates before it needed to (that's adjustable, but the default settings turn off syncing/updating when battery is critical).The large battery also takes a while to charge, so you can't just throw it on the charger for a few minutes to top-up (but neither do you have to top-up often), instead I usually plan when I'll need to charge the phone and do so overnight so it's fully charged and ready to go when I leave in the morning. Exchanging the old constant charging and being tethered to USB power, for occasionally having to plan ahead when to charge is a decent trade-off in my book.The other big adjustment I had to make was the increased heft-- the phone is now much bigger and much heavier than before, although it still fits well in my front jeans pocket. Holding the phone up for a while (like lying in bed) definitely reminds my wrist that the phone weighs more now. The grip still feels natural in my hand.[ I was given this product for the purposes of review. I received no other compensation, and my review is my honest opinion of the product. ]I'd wish for better accuracy in how Android perceives its battery capacity-- the extended "critical" period makes it hard to predict how much juice you really have left. The brand name might be on the unusual side, but the extended run-time and easy integration make this ZeroLemon high-capacity battery a winner. Highly Recommended.

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-08: First, customer service. The items arrived a day ahead of schedule. They were well-packaged but, when I opened the envelopes, the TPU case had a small scuff on it. Not terrible, but a bit annoying for a new item. I wanted to start using the battery, though, so I installed it (with the scuffed case) and I took a photo of the scuff, and emailed it to Bastexwireless via Amazon, asking if they would be willing to replace the case. I asked that I be allowed to keep the scuffed case in the meantime, to allow me to use the battery. Next day I got a friendly reply, saying that a new case would be put in the mail that day. Sure enough, the replacement case arrived a few days later, in perfect shape. Great customer service.Second, the battery. It's awesome. It arrived Tuesday. Upon installation, it showed a charge level of 64%. After charging it overnight as directed, I unplugged the phone at 6:30AM Wednesday, and used it very heavily during the day -- far more heavily than usual, because I wanted to run the battery down as fast as I could, so that I could complete the recommended several cycles of "deplete / recharge" in as few days as possible. Even with heavy use, it lasted more than 24 hours. That included almost 10 hours of screen-on time, and almost constant WiFi & 4G connection. (My phone is rooted, I'm running KitKat 4.4.2 on Shiny ROM). I let the phone run down to 2% charge (it reached that level about 9AM Thursday, i.e., after about 26.5 hours) then I put it on a charger; it took about 6 hours to reach full charge.So I unplugged it Thursday about 3PM, and used the phone normally. It lasted through Thursday, all day Friday, and through to Saturday late evening before I put it on an overnight charge. Unplugged it 7AM Sunday morning, used it all day, and didn't put it on charge overnight. Same thing Monday, and no overnight charge. It's now Tuesday, 2:30PM (almost 2.5 days after unplugging the phone) and it's reading 37% !!I still have a few cycles of full charge / full discharge to go, but it seems pretty amazing. I used to charge my phone overnight every night, but with this battery I expect to be charging the phone only every second (or perhaps third) night. More importantly, though -- no more having to "baby" the phone during the day !

    Rating: 5

    2014-06-28: Superior to all others, the battery itself, and also included case, are beyond those of any competitors for the sa!me device.

    Rating: 5

    2013-06-30: Now that I have had some time using this battery I will say it is awesome! I have taken the charger out of my car and office. The only time I charge now is at night. It isn't that I need to charge it most nights but rather, that I want to make sure I have enough power for the next night. I leave the screen on while using my GPS and All Access for an hour or two at a time. Though I don't always run it down all the way I am getting 16-18 hours a day with 3+ hours of screen time and I still have over 35% at the least. I could easily get 24-30+ hours of use on a full charge. This battery is worth every dollar I paid for it.The battery is really large but for the ability to use my phone and just leave the screen on and not be tethered to a charger all of the time is a fair trade. I carried a Blackberry years ago and this isn't much worse than that was size and weight-wise. I like the case and it is protective. If you really want to use your phone and don't want to be bound to an outlet all of the time buy one of these batteries.

    Rating: 5

    2013-05-09: This battery works! That's all there is to say about that. I went from about 10 hours total between charges, to 36. I would also only get about 1 hour of screen time, before my phone was needing a charge. Now, I get over 4 hours, and my desk at work is in a very poor area for signal.The only shortcoming is the case. It's good, but not great. Like others have said, both microphones are covered by the case. You need to modify the case to uncover the microphones. This is a glaring omission on ZeroLemon's part. I hope they fix this in future revisions of the case. Also, the cover doesn't fit properly over the top of the phone, near the ear piece. It's difficult to remove the case from the phone, so I'm not worried about it coming off, but it just doesn't look good. Lastly, the buttons for volume and power are hard to press with the case on. I ended up having to cut holes in the case, so I wouldn't have to push too hard on the phone, just so it would turn on.The phone feels good in the hand, despite the extra heft of the battery. Without a case, this phone is slippery. I am still able to use the phone one handed, and I have no issues with space in my pocket for the phone.If ZeroLemon fixes the issues with the case, I'd gladly give this a 5 star review. I wanted to give it a 3 star review, but because the battery is so awesome, I gave it a 4.You can check out pictures and my review over at XDA ([...]

    Rating: 4

The dust cloth is also one of the better ones I've ever gotten with screen protectors (it's bigger and more substantial than they usually are -- in fact, just used it to clean my touch screen computer screen!) My only recommendation would be to install from bottom up as lining up with the home button is probably the most important on there. Would definitely buy again!By the way, big THANKS to the reviewer who mentioned the other S pen tips. Definitely needed to switch out the rubber tip for the included plastic tip to glide on the screen while writing notes (the rubber gets caught). Works perfectly with the plastic tip!

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-21: iSmooth did me a solid. They sent me an email with additional info on how to optimally apply the protector before Amazon shipped it to me. It arrived timely, and had everything in the pack I expected. I went to iSmooth's website and found an instruction video for my phone (note3), which helped. Ultimately, by using the dust stickers, I got every speck and have a clean application on the first protector. My first. I recommend watching their videos and reading the instructions.Lastly, for note 3 S-pen users, yes, the default tip on the pen feels rough on screen protectors. I tried it on several types of protectors and all of them were about the same as the iSmooth. The Trick: the default tip in your S-pen is a slightly rubberized one. In the tip/nib pack that comes with the phone, there are three rubberized and two plastic tips. If you look at them with magnified lenses (reading glasses), you can see which is which (rubberized ones are dull, plastic a little more shiny). Replace the tip with the Samsung S-pen tool and use a plastic one to get smooth action on the screen protector.

    2013-10-30: The iSmooth screen protector turned out to be a good buy for me. The package came with everything you needed for the install. The kit came with 3 screen protectors, a large cleaning cloth, dust removal stickers, and installation instructions and other documentation. I've purchased many screen protectors in the past and this is the first time I've received a decent sized cleaning cloth. It may not be a big deal to others but this was a pleasant surprise for me. The install instructions were very detailed and straight forward. They even had a website you could visit to watch a video of the installation process for those that need visuals. Although they didn't have an install video for the Note 3, they did have a video for the Note 2. The video instructions sequence was the following: Turn off phone, wipe down screen with cleaning cloth, remove tab 1 and apply screen protector, identify dust bubbles (not air bubbles) and use dust removal stickers to remove the dust, finish applying screen protector pushing out all air bubbles, and remove tab 2. I figured why should I apply the screen protector first to identify dust bubbles. After cleaning the screen with the cleaning cloth, I used a dust removal sticker all throughout the screen before applying the screen protector. After doing this, I did not see a single dust bubble. Once I pushed out all the air bubbles, the screen appeared crystal clear.Overall, this screen protector looks great. I highly recommend this screen protector. This product also has a lifetime warranty.

    2013-12-11: I just got these protectors today.     Rating: 5

    2013-11-19: love these protectors, they are super clear and easy to apply. you are given a 3 pack. They are very easy to remove and re-apply if necessary.

    Rating: 4

    2013-10-10: The name Gorilla Glass sounds like your phone screen is indestructible. It's not. I managed to put a gouge in one device screen a week after I'd bought it, to my horror followed by months of muttering and self loathing. The near invisible sheet of film of a screen protector will run interference and save both your peace of mind and the resale value of your expensive telephone investment. Admittedly, applying protective film to any glass surface can be a mind-numbing exercise that requires patience and more skill than you might first imagine. That's one reason why car window tinters, for example, often charge a small fortune. Previous screen protection products I've used all came with small bottles of fluids and tiny squeegees, so it was a relief to see that this iSmooth product was liquid free. Basically, you receive a film "sandwich". The top and bottom layers have tabs that help you peel them off. Peel off the top two inches of the bottom layer, align it, place the now exposed middle layer of the sandwich over your screen. Continue to peel the tabbed outer layer off and pressing the rest of the mid protective layer against your screen. Once that's complete, you gently peel the top layer of the sandwich off grabbing its tabbed edge. Finish by smoothing the film out with the included microfiber cloth to make certain of full contact and adhesion as well as to eliminate any trapped air that will form a small bubble. If you were a bit off on the alignment, you can lift the film up again to reposition it. Try to avoid that by not being in a hurry. The single most important factor in this process is keeping clean and most of all DUST FREE. Any tiny speck of dust will prevent the film from contacting the glass and cause a visible bubble. ISmooth includes several small stickers that you can use to lift dust off of either the screen or the sticky side of the film just before it makes contact with the screen. You can use scotch tape if you prefer to remove a speck. Make sure you have a well lit work area so you can see the surfaces you're working with up close. If you make a bonehead mistake, fear not. Your package has 3 film "sandwiches" so you get several do-overs should you need them. There's a web address provided where you can watch the process and complete your film school if you like. The process is really very simple with dust being your only nemesis. I loved that there was no drying time like past protectors required. There were absolutely no bubbles or marks of any kind. The protective film in place looks exactly like the glass screen did without it. Screen touch reactance is exactly the same as well. The name Ultra Premium HD sounds a little overdone and self aggrandizing, but the results are spectacular. Invisible protection. On that day you shriek in horror to see what the key in your pocket did to the phone the one time you flung it in there, you'll be glad you took the time and minimal expense. There's a lifetime guarantee, so if you manage to use the three films they send you, you're still covered. There are more expensive alternates, but I couldn't be happier with my results!

    Rating: 5

    2014-02-01: This screen protector offers excellent protection. It is easy to install and does not affect any aspect of the touch screen sensitivity. I've tried other screen protectors but none have met the high quality of these. Excellent product which I highly recommend!

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-19: In theory, a screen protector doesn't interfere with the use or cosmetics of your device while providing protection for life's little mishaps that inevitably will scratch and mar the face of your very expensive status symbol. In a perfect world, you won't notice it's there, and should you manage to pick up a scratch on your screen, you can rest easy knowing it's not on the glass, but on the replaceable protector.Many screen protectors claim to be invisible, and/or undetectable. This is _never_ the case. However, this particular protector is ALMOST imperceptible, which I appreciate. It so far has done a good job of not getting scratched during the 3-4 weeks I've been using it, which I also appreciate (because if you're putting a screen protector on your device, it's because a scratched screen bothers you and even though it's just the protector, it still looks terrible if it gets scratched).Installation was easy enough for my ham hands, but I did manage to get 2 tiny dust particles under the bottom right edge and a tiny bubble along the left edge that with a bulkier case would be covered (I have tried to push it out being right on the edge, but I must have damaged the adhesive during installation and now it just won't stay down).The pack comes with most of the the things you'll need for installation, a dust-free lens wiper, and protective covers with tags for easier maneuvering during install, instructions etc. I waited until the wife was in the shower and took advantage of a steamy bathroom to further reduce my chances of dust, and it all went pretty smoothly considering my ham-handedness.So why did I give this protector 4 stars when I so far have given it a 5-star worthy review? Well, there's just one thing, really.The number one thing I don't like is the texture of the protector was extremely unpleasant to my finger at first, and caused the S-Pen to drag, which made me not want to use my phone, and almost caused me to pull the protector off and throw it away. But I decided to give it a chance since I'm cheap and this cost me money, and as I've used it more, it has stopped dragging the S-Pen (not entirely, but it's manageable now) and the texture has become less unpleasant (again, not completely, but better none the less). The pad of my finger can still become a little sore from extended use, but it does take a while for it to start getting annoying now, and when it does I just switch to the S-Pen. Also, I can see it from a mile away. And I hate that, but I realize this is my own neurosis, and that the average person isn't going to see it even with the imperfections from my botched install (so after some mental wrestling with myself I've bumped the review to 4 stars over my initial 3).Other things about this protector you probably want to know: It seems to be relatively good at resisting major fingerprints, but does collect some. It's fairly easy to wipe off, but not as easy as the bare screen was. However the bare screen collected fingerprints like a champ, so it's a trade off. And it is cut very well so the edges all line up with the device nicely, making it that much harder to see. So fine, I'll ignore the nagging neurosis screaming in the back of my head for 3 stars and give it 4 stars. I don't think I will ever in my life be able to give any screen protector 5 stars, so consider this a glowing review. Also, a few up votes wouldn't hurt since I am pretty sure I've mentally scared myself for life with this 4 star review.

    Rating: 4

    2014-05-08: This screen protector does exactly what I wanted it to do: protect the screen of my new Samsung Galaxy Note 3 without becoming a distraction.It was easy to apply. I used the "hinge" method to apply it instead of the method recommended by the manufacturer. I used this method because I have found that it is the easiest way to assure proper alignment and placement. And because I used this method and the fact that this screen protector was perfectly cut, I got the exact fit that I wanted. For the first time ever, I had to use one of the little sticky Dust Removal Stickers included in the kit, and it too worked very well.Sensitivity and clarity are also excellent. I only need to use the lightest touch on the screen to get a response, which speaks well for the screen on the Note 3 and for this screen protector. I chose the clear protector to maximize the visibility of the screen, and the visibility is excellent as long as the screen is not in bright sunlight. There is a little glare in bright sunlight, but that's always going to be true when you use a clear protector, regardless of the brand, so I'm OK with that -- just turn so that your phone is shaded by your body and you'll be OK.I hope to own this phone for a good long time, so maybe I'll actually get to use all 3 screen protectors that come in this pack. So far though, the one I applied seems like it will last a good long time.This is a good screen protector and cheap insurance for your smartphone's screen. And as always, Amazon's price and fast delivery just make the deal that much sweeter.

    2013-10-17: I have been applying screen protectors to devices since the original Palm Pilot came out. I've even applied screen protectors using the identical three layer process. I have never had a problem. Yet I just spent an HOUR trying to successfully get one of these useless things on my Samsung Galaxy Note 3. I finally removed more than two inches of that backing so there's enough to actually stick to the phone. I thought I actually got it but there were HUGE air pockets around the edges of the phone. In error, I thought I could "buff" them out, but it's impossible (and no, they're not from dust). And NOW, there's no protective backing so the entire screen protector needs to be lifted and re=smoothed with the whole thing exposed to air and potential dust. I suspect this is design related with the protector being a bit too wide. The slightly raised lip of the Galaxy Note 3 makes it impossible to get the protector flush against the sides of the device, so it lifts (air pockets). You can try to smooth out the huge air gaps but they return again and again because you can't get the protector 100% flush against the phone.The first protector somehow got a hairline crease in it, so I had to try a second protector and experienced the same air pockets. Now, dust has inevitably comes into play from my many frustrated attempts to fit this stupid thing (dust removal stickers are a sick joke - they do NOT remove dust from the protector's tacky side at all), so I'm going to have try the third - and I ALWAYS get protectors installed first try. I've never needed to go to a second, never mind a third.Unless you enjoy futility, frustration and wasting money, AVOID.

    2014-01-15: For thin, clear plastic this is a decent screen protector. It's very clear but does show lots of finger prints and lint. This type of screen protector is not going to protect your expensive phone screen from a serious flat faced drop on a hard surface like a top of the line glass protector (Iloome or Spigen) with a hardness of 8 or 9, but it's better than nothing for protection against light abrasions and short/soft drops. Also, since they are inexpensive (3 in a box), they can easily be replaced as needed. If you're the very careful type with your electronic gear, this might be all you need.

    2013-10-24: This screen protector is EXACTLY the same size as the Note 3 screen, which means that if you are one teeny little hair off, the protector will be up on the lip around the edge of the phone. So it is going to take some time under a bright lamp to get the installation right. Just be patient. It can be done. Eventually. I did manage with the first protector but it took more than 20 iterations of realigning the leading edge. I think this protector could stand to be a tiny minuscule bitty bit smaller. Just enough that putting it on isn't microsurgery. On the other hand, if your microsurgery is successful, it is right up to the edge and that much more invisible and nice for it.Once it is on, the protector is absolutely smooth and invisible. But, you'll notice that your s-pen wants to drag and stick. That's because you don't have the right nib in it. Remember that tiny little packet of nibs and that little metal nib remover that shipped with your Note 3? Take a really close look at those nibs. 2 of them are a slightly different color of greyish white than the others. Those are the less rubbery ones that work with screen protectors. Swap out your nib and you won't have a problem. In fact it might even be a little smoother than before.(You may now commence destroying your office attempting to locate the itty bitty little pack of nibs. It's gotta be somewhere, right?)

    2013-12-25: I've tried various screen protector brands for the iPad and iPod Touch, some of which were difficult to put on, or showed a rainbow effect on the surface. I recently bought a Galaxy Note 3 and was deciding on what to get for a screen protector. After reviewing several brands and user ratings, I decided to purchase the iSmooth Clear Premium HD protector. They provide 3 screen protectors and a lifetime warranty. The package also includes some dust removal stickers and a large cleaning cloth that is the perfect size for the Note 3 screen. It was fairly easy to apply the first time, and you don't need to use any spray solutions. Just a tip - Before you begin to unpeel the back plastic sheet off the back, make sure that both sides of the protector are free of any lint and dust particles. Otherwise when you start peeling the back layer down, some particles may fall on the screen. Work any bubbles from the center out to the sides for best results. This protector fits perfectly around the home button and edges. If you decide to put a protective case around the phone, the screen protector fits fine with the lip of the case. The clarity of the screen with the protector is outstanding, and the protector also works fine with the stylus. Very satisfied and definitely worth the cost.

    2013-07-11: Honestly... my wife is the Anti-Tech.Laptops slow down when she comes to use them. Flatbed scanners lose track of where they were on the page. Printer servers seem to lose their jobs somewhere in vaporspace. Seriously, her idea of high tech is a digital children's thermometer...A couple years ago, the kids and I helped her migrate from the realm of flip phones to the smart phone world, and the Samsung Illusion is the phone that the kids picked out for her as a birthday gift. It was the right choice for the job -- not too complex, not too many bells & whistles, just the right size for her somewhat petite hands, and easy to navigate. Of course, she jumped head first into texting with family and friends.It took her a few months to put away her paper address book and start to use the phone's Contacts functionality. Took even longer for her to get comfortable using the Illusion to check and send email. Now she's progressed to taking and sharing pictures, reading and sending work files and other pdfs, and using Google Navigator.Yes, she is finally on her way in the smart phone world. Now if she would only get comfortable remembering to take her phone with her wherever she goes, and stop putting it back into her purse (... and then taking it back out again, over & over) each and every time she sends and receives individual texts.One thing that we did notice is that the charge on the original battery lasted, on average, a little over one day. That battery died a few weeks ago, after about two years, and the Samsung OEM replacement purchased on Amazon (Li-Ion Polymer OEM Replacement Battery (1500mAh) for Samsung Illusion (EB484659YZ)) has been fantastic. We think the charge on this one lasts even longer than the initial one did.If you are looking for a good starter smart phone that is reasonably priced and easy to use, we highly recommend that you consider the Samsung Illusion based on our experience with it.
